Joseph Muszynski is a writer and producer, known for Legend, Peace, Love & Misunderstanding (2011) and Mahjong and the West (2014).
Jacqueline Chong was born on May 1, 1980 in Malaysia. She is an actress and producer, known for Brain Juice (2011), Gang jiong (2015) and Iceman (2014).
Erica Joseph Hunter is known for her work on ...e ora parliamo di Kevin (2011), Il matrimonio che vorrei (2012) and Animal - Il segreto della foresta (2014).
Owen Mulligan is a director and writer, known for Incident at Montauk (2019), Kradeht (2015) and The Smog (2010).
Jared Newman is an actor and composer, known for Donovan Reid (2019), The Last Hit (2020) and Single (2020).

Samuel Joshua is a writer, director, and composer based in Michigan. He has written music for feature films, short films, and documentaries, and earned his doctorate in music composition from Michigan State University. Samuel made his debut as a film director with the creation of Danbury Files, a kids series set in the 1920s.

Born in India, Avishek Majumder is a film composer, screen writer & producer. He started his career with advertising and non-film music, he debuted as a film composer in year 2013. Trained in western classical music & jazz from Thames Valley University, noted for his film songs and soundtracks which combine melodies & western harmonies with traditional instrumentation orchestrated with synthetic sounds.
column6: July 14, 1988 in Siliguri, West Bengal, India

column5: Ali Sarabi is an actor, known for Khoshksali Va Doroogh (2016), Ashkan, angoshtar-e motebarek va dastan-haye digar (2008) and I Want to Dance (2017).
Lalo Prieto is a director and actor, known for El Derechazo (2013) and Velódromo (2010).

Jordan Horowitz is an award-winning writer, director and producer. His film Painless was released theatrically in 2018 after a successful festival run and premiered on Showtime Networks, Virgin Atlantic and Emiratis airlines in 2019. His previous documentary Angel of Nanjing (2015) was a festival darling, winning 13 awards at prestigious festivals around the world. It became an Internet sensation when NowThis News posted a Facebook story about it that was viewed over 22 million times.Jordan also directs and produces commercials, music videos and a variety of TV content. His short film work has also won numerous awards and is referenced in the book "Making It Big in Shorts: The Ultimate Filmmaker's Guide to Short Films", by Kim Adelman.
Siamak Safari is an actor, known for Eterafate Zehne Khatarnake Man (2015), Akharin Bar Key Sahar Ra Didi (2016) and Emkane Mina (2016).

Emily Skeggs is an American stage and screen actress best known for her Tony-nominated performance as Medium Alison in the 2015 Broadway production of Fun Home.Skeggs was born and raised in New York City where she fell in love with theatre at a very young age after attending a Broadway production of Guys and Dolls. She studied drama at Fiorello H. LaGuardia High School (the Fame school) and pursued her interests further at Emerson College, graduating with a degree in acting and a minor in writing.She performed in numerous Off-Broadway and Regional stage productions before making her Broadway debut in Fun Home in March 2015. Emily made her TV debut in June 2015 on Late Nite with Seth Meyers, performing Changing My Major from Fun Home.
column6: July 10, 1990 in New York City, New York, USA
column8: New York City, New York, USA

column5: Yekaterina Petrashko is a production designer and set decorator, known for Rok-n-roll pod Kremlyom (2013), Pobeg (2005) and Antikiller 2: Antiterror (2003).
David Alen is an actor and writer, known for Jack the Reaper (2011), Il volto biondo della pazzia (2017) and The Promotion (2018).
Deepika is an actress, known for Gulumaal: The Escape (2009), Sanmanasullavan Appukuttan (2009) and Ulakam Chuttum Valiban (2011).
Jaivey Gebbink is an actor, known for De indiaan (2009).

Paul started out writing sketch comedy for the TV, during which time he put words into the mouths of a variety of prime time performers, including Hale & Pace, Brian Conley, Russ Abbot and even Eric Cantona's Spitting Image puppet in the very last episode of the show.He has had two non-fiction titles published, written for magazines, the stage, individual West End performers and has even written several dozen bespoke wedding speeches.His first original screenplay Four has its premiere at the Empire Leicester Square on October 10th 2011.Since Four, Paul has seen his horror/thriller script Airborne filmed, (starring Mark Hamill and Julian Glover and due for release later this year).His next original screenplay, The Kruger is in pre-production and hopes to start shooting in South Africa in early 2012.

Nick Keller is a composer, producer, and multi-instrumentalist musician whose musical career spans over a decade. His work can be heard across major television networks like Cartoon Network & Nickelodeon in over 100 countries worldwide, most recently on Unikitty!, one of the most popular animated shows on the air.The foundation of Nick's music is inspired by his love of synthesizers, and combining the modern sound of soft synth with the classic orchestral elements. As a mostly self-taught pianist since the age of 5, he relies heavily on his background in production and electronic music to create music film & TV scores. In 2016, Nick joined longtime collaborator Ed Skudder on Unikitty! to score the hit animated Lego Movie spin-off. The show quickly became #3 on Cartoon Network worldwide in under six months. Using his accomplished background as a songwriter, he has written & produced over 20 original songs for the first two seasons of the show.With over a decade of experience in producing and composing, Nick has scored over 175 episodes of television and series, on leading cable networks like Cartoon Network, Nickelodeon and Warner Brothers. His versatile background in electronic & orchestral music puts him at the forefront of up and coming composers.
Jennifer De Lucia is an actress and producer, known for I misteri di Murdoch (2008), Mr. D (2012) and The Amazing Gayl Pile (2014).
Archana Kavi was born on January 4, 1990 in New Delhi, India as Archana Jose Harish Kavi. She is an actress and writer, known for Salt n' Pepper (2011), Aravaan (2012) and Day Night Game (2014).
Rachel Lara is known for her work on Number 9, Killer Holiday (2013) and Her Saturday Night Special (2017).
Curt Lobb is an editor and producer, known for Nirvanna the Band the Show (2016), Little Matthew (2014) and BBQ Crawl (2013).
Gloria Ng is a producer and actress, known for Ebola Zombies (2015) and Africa Rise (2010).
Abhinay Khoparzi is an actor and cinematographer, known for Kshay (2011).
Sudhir Pednekar is an actor, known for Sangharsh (2014) and Kshay (2011).
Dixie Collins is an actress, known for Rise of the Black Bat (2012) and Iron Soldier (2010).
Ransel Cass is an actor, known for Hajji Washington (1983).

Non (born: Rena Nounen) was born in Kamikawa town in Hyogo, Japan and raised in this beautiful rural town. She won the prize of Nicola Model Audition when she's the 7th grade, and started the modeling carrier. On graduating her junior high school, she moved to Tokyo to pursue her dream to be an actress. She is best known for Amachan (2013), Hot Road (2014) , Kurage-Hime(Princess Jellyfish) (1995) and Kono Sekai No Katasumi Ni (In This Corner Of The World) (2016).
Greta Bohacek was born on May 23, 2000 in Germany. She is an actress, known for Suspiria (2018), About: Kate (2013) and Jupiter (2019).
Chempil Asokan is an actor, known for Valliyum Thetti Pulliyum Thetti (2016), Anarkali (2015) and Puthan Panam (2017).
Yukito Nishii is an actor, known for Wolf Children - Ame e Yuki i bambini lupo (2012), Confessions (2010) and Gekijôban Urutoraman Rûbu: Serekuto! Kizuna no kurisutaru (2019).
Deeksha Seth was born on February 14, 1990 in Delhi, India. She is an actress and talent agent, known for Vedam (2010), Vettai Mannan and Nippu (2012).

Irina Gorbacheva was born on April 10, 1988 in Zhdanov, Donetskaya oblast, Ukrainian SSR, USSR as Irina Anatolevna Gorbachyova. She is an actress and talent agent, known for Aritmiya (2017), Istoriya odnogo naznacheniya (2018) and Ikariya. She was previously married to Grigoriy Kalinin.

column5: Peter Whittaker is an actor and director, known for Raiders of the Lost Shark (2015), Thoughts and Prayers 2.0 and Iron Soldier (2010).
Adityavardhan Gupta is an actor, known for Kshay (2011).

Benedikt "Ben" Blaskovic grew up in Germany as the grandson of a Croatian Co-Worker who came to Germany during WWII. He was born and raised at Lake Tegernsee and Lake Schliersee in Bavaria. In young age he learned to play drums and guitar. Throughout his whole pupil-time he played in many bands. After the establishment of a drama group at school he explored the passion for acting. When he finished school in 2008 Ben decided to become an actor and take private lessons at noted coaches and teachers in the U.S. and Germany before he accepted his first paid role in 2009. Meanwhile he also shot several short movies to improve his acting and to gather contacts and references. In 2010 he shot his first motion picture "Frankfurt Coincidences", which won the audience prize on Munich Filmfest 2011. In the same time he was nominated as best newcomer actor on the same film fest. And also in 2011 he shot his next motion picture "Harms" while he was booked for different tv movies and series. After 3 years of playing roles in many other tv movies and series such as "Schafkopf", "Die Hebamme", "Seitensprung" or "Letzte Spur Berlin" he produced his own motion picture "Im Nesseltal" (Regie: Philipp J. Pamer) in which he also played one of the leads. Therefore his production company Victus Films was established. The movie was later shown on 50th Hofer Filmtage in 2016. In 2015 Ben Blaskovic accepted a lead in the famous German crime-series "Die Rosenheim Cops". In the same year "Rusty Waters", a small album as Singer/Songwriter, was released by him. 2016 he shot his next motion picture in english: "One Shot Left".
Maninder Singh is an actor, known for Kya Haal, Mr. Paanchal? (2017), Hey Bro (2015) and Khelein Hum Jee Jaan Sey (2010).
Vidushi Mehra is an actress, known for Raees (2017), No One Killed Jessica (2011) and 7 Khoon Maaf (2011).

Gianna LePera is an American actress and singer best known for her film work in Vamperifica and Play House and television roles on Law and Order SVU, Modern Family, Trophy Wife, About a Boy and Preacher. Gianna began her career in musical theater, and at the age of 10, landed the lead role of Susan in a musical adaptation of Miracle on 34th Street in New York's John Engeman Theater. Gianna's performance earned her critical acclaim including this review from the NY Times: "Gianna LePera, the 10-year-old who plays Susan, is equally beguiling, displaying a delicate somberness similar to the haunting performance the young Natalie Wood gave in the film." (Miracle on 34th Street Review, NY Times, Nov 29th 2009)LePera was born in New York City and is the only child of Lisa McLaughlin and Frank LePera. In Manhattan LePera attended the Professional Children's School. At age 11 Gianna landed the role of Susan in the National Tour of Irving Berlin's White Christmas. Later, Gianna and her parents lived bi-coastal between NYC and LA, spending most of her high school years in LA. LePera continued to work on both coasts appearing in television commercials and episodics. She appeared in live concerts at the famed Joe's Pub in NYC as well as with the Brooklyn Youth Chorus. In 2012 Gianna played young Tracey in the film, Vamperifica, the younger version of the lead role played by Dreema Walker. While auditioning in 2012 during her first pilot season in LA, LePera secured the role of Hillary in ABC's pilot Trophy Wife starring Malin Akerman, Bradley Whitford and Marcia Gay Harden. In October of 2013 she booked a lead role in the Amazon pilot Maker Shack Agency and later guest starred on NBC's About a Boy, The NightShift, and ABC's Modern Family. She currently recurs on AMC's dark comedy Preacher.
Shelley-Jean Harrison is an actress, known for Iron Soldier (2010) and Blood Red Moon (2010).

Kasumi Yamaya was born on December 26, 1996 in Miyagi Prefecture, Japan. She is an actress, known for Confessions (2010), Fake Plastic Planet (2020) and Gekijôban Dôbutsu Sentai Jûôjâ Tai Ninninjâ Mirai kara no Messêji Furomu Sûpâ Sentai (2017).

Jeneta St. Clair, originally from Sheboygan, Wisconsin, was raised Indiana from age 12 until her final year in high school. Afterwards, she attended college at American Musical and Dramatic Academy in Los Angeles. Jeneta completed her studies in February 2010. In that same year, Jeneta landed her first two film jobs, beginning with Ernesto Wood (2010) and Gut-to-Go (2010). The following year, Jeneta worked on four consecutive projects including La collana dell'amore (2011), Edges (2011), the direct-to-video comedy Barely Legal (2011) and an appearance on the series I Didn't Know I Was Pregnant (2008). 2012 saw Jeneta in a leading role in sci-FY odyssey Paradox Alice (2012) along with other busying projects. Jeneta continued her momentum into 2013 with further films including the horror film The Appearing (2014), the mystery dram film Erasing Eden (2016) and the mystery film After Midnight (2014). In between film work, Jeneta does stand-up comedy, writes and produces projects that she is passionate about.
Iggy Malmborg is an actor, known for Nånting måste gå sönder (2014), Unga Sophie Bell (2014) and Skumtimmen (2013).
Eilidh Rankin is an actress, known for L'illusionista (2010).

Lara Heller performs in 4 languages fluently; English, German, French and Persian. Lara was a professional figure skater for Germany and graduated with a degree in law from The London School Of Economics and an MA in Acting from Arts Ed. She was born in England and raised in a mountain village in Germany, Switzerland and Luxembourg. Lara now splits her time between LA and London.Lara first came to public attention as the actress in The Cut, which won the Vittorio Veneto Award at the Venice Film Festival. The story is about a father (Tahar Rahim) searching for his twin daughters (Lara Heller). The film was endorsed by Martin Scorsese who was quoted as saying "Fatih Akin's The Cut is a genuine, hand-made epic, of the type that people just don't make anymore."Recent credits include the new David Bowie movie, Stardust, by Gabriel Range (Salon Pictures), The Obscure Life Of The Grand Duke Of Corsica with Timothy Spall and Peter Stormare and the video game NBA2K.Lara has a body of action work due to her love of sports and on screen combat training. Water sports include trick-wakeboarding, waterskiing, surfing, swimming, fly boarding and diving. Winter sports include professional figure skating and skiing. Dance training includes contemporary, jazz, waltz, salsa and Persian dancing.
Dejan Mircea is an actor, known for Profane (2011).
Zoe Fraser is an actress, known for Anna dai capelli rossi - Promesse e giuramenti (2017), The Curse of Clara: A Holiday Tale (2015) and The Last Halloween (2014).

Born in Manhattan, New York and raised in San Juan, Puerto Rico. Nick studied at the University of Puerto Rico and received a Bachelor of Arts degree in pre-Legal studies with a minor in Drama and Psychology. Although he is the son of late prominent lawyer father, Nick chose a different path and received an Associate of Computer Science degree graduating Magna Cum Laude with a minor in Accounting and Finance. His passion has always been the Arts. Nick has been involved in commercial, industrial and educational videos. He has done several theatrical plays in Jacksonville; Chicago, Illinois; and Tallahassee, Florida.Nick often gravitates between Information Technology and the motion picture filming industry, marketing, and sales. He also is a talented cartoonist, computer animator, and an award winning screenplay writer. His creativity stems from being raised in a very rich, creative, and nurturing environment provided by his late mother Angie, a laureate graduate PhD (Cornell University). A philanthropist at heart, occasion permitting, Nick gets involved in charity work focused on the feed the children like Worldwide Vision, UNICEF, and other organizations. Nick was a member of the Disaster Medical Assistance Team Florida 4 deployed to provide medical assistance to the victims of Hurricane Katrina and Rita.
Sophie Handa is an actress, known for Help (2010).
Ben Litwinschuh is an actor, known for Im Spinnwebhaus (2015), Moritz und der Waldschrat (2013) and Die Drei von der Müllabfuhr (2019).

Breanna Yde is a talented young actress who currently stars in the role of "Tomika" in Nickelodeon's highly anticipated new series School of Rock, which premieres in 2016. She will also recur as "Ronnie Anne" on Nickelodeon's upcoming animated series The Loud House, premiering in 2016. Breanna previously starred as "Frankie" on Nickelodeon's live-action supernatural comedy, The Haunted Hathaways. She also guest starred on the Nick at Nite series Instant Mom. Some of her film credits include the Nickelodeon Movie for Television Santa Hunters, directed by Savage Steve Holland and The Dark Prophecy, directed by Anthony E. Zuiker. Breanna is also a talented musician. She sings and is learning to play both the piano and the guitar.Breanna was born in Sydney, Australia and is a dual citizen of Australia and the United States. She grew up in Las Vegas, San Diego and currently lives in Los Angeles. She also loves playing sports like tennis, golf and basketball. Breanna is the youngest of six kids, four of which are grown.

Tyler James Nicol is a writer and actor who was born in New Westminster, British Columbia, Canada. He has appeared on stage, screen, and internet devices internationally. He is noted for his works with short-film group Megasteakman including many viral sensations such as "Pokemon APOKEalypse" and "28 Geeks Later". As of 2015 he resides in Vancouver, British Columbia and works in the field of animated feature films.
Christina Storm is an actress, known for Kite (2014), Eternity (2010) and Ek Lief Jou (2011).
Lilly Reulein was born in 2002. She is an actress, known for Yoko - Uno yeti per amico (2012), Dahoam is Dahoam (2007) and Reunited (2014).
Mari Komatsuzaki is an actress, known for Hana to hebi 3 (2010).

Christopher is an actor and stunt performer known for, 'Inside number 9', 'Assassin's Creed', 'Cannibals and Carpet Fitters' and 'Rev'. He graduated from Sheffield University with a degree in Economics before completing a post graduate course at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art. Christopher is skilled in various forms of martial arts with advanced screen combat experience. Additional skills include; gymnastics, trampoline, Horse riding, high diving, Scuba diving and climbing. In Addition, he has also performed as a picture double for Taylor Kitsch, Michael Fassbender, Dylan O'Bryan, Sam Riley, Aaron Taylor-Johnson and various other characters.

Claire Sermonne (born December 26 1985) is a French-Russian actress.She is Lucile in Monsieur Cauchemar (Mister Nightmare), one of the last but not least of Jean-Pierre Mocky's movie, and Louise de Rohan in Outlander Season 2, a British-American television drama series created by Ronald D. Moore and produced by Sony/Left Bank for Starz. She is known for playing Chimène in the stage play Le Cid directed by Alain Ollivier in France at The Nuits de Fourvière festival. She is also known for playing Marguerite in the stage play La Dame aux camélias directed by Frank Castorf at Odéon-theatre of Europe in Paris. She played Valérie Marneff in La Cousine Bette directed by Frank Castorf at The Volksbühne in Berlin.She was last seen at the Avignon festival IN playing the historian in the last Valère Novarina stage play, Le Viviers des noms.Claire Sermonne is also a founder of the theater festival Le Festival du Nouveau Théâtre Populaire in the West of France.Claire is a graduate of the Art Theater School of Moscow (MXAT).She was a student of Alla Pokrovskaia, Dmitri Brusnikin, and Roman Kozak

Luke Corradine is an award winning music composer and co-founder of Fizz-e-Motion, now based in London and Cannes. Having shared a stage with Buddy Guy, played to thousands at the V&A in London, composed for ballet at the Bloomsbury Theatre, Nokia and Lego commercials as well as several award winning feature films, it is safe to say that Luke's commercial knowledge and musical experience is far from average. At an early age, Luke studied music composition & jazz in Madrid, under Berklee College of Music professor Pedro Iturralde whilst studying world cinema with a focus on Mizoguchi, Antonioni, F.W. Murnau and Billy Wilder. In early 2000 he was spotted by famed talent scout Rob Deacon and signed to Deviant Records to later appear on some of the best selling releases of the decade including Now 2004 alongside Kylie Minogue and Justin Timberlake. In those early days he also recorded with #1 artist Robert Owens (Fingers Inc) picking up praise along the way from Boy George and Jon Marsh. As the first decade of the millennium progressed, Luke solidified his work in advertising, especially in collaboration with award-winning agency Salt TV while composing for ABC News' documentary Trivial Royale - covering the Royal Wedding - and writing songs for BBC series E20. In 2011 Luke scores the music for British thriller 'The Smoke' (Matt Di Angelo, Alan Ford) and multi-award winning air disaster film 'Last Flight to Abuja'. He received an African Movie Academy Award, known as the African 'Oscar' for his African folklore-infused music score in the film Onye Ozi. Several independent film commissions followed, such as 'Hard Time Bus' (Best Film - Hollywood Black Film Festival), additional music to Vanessa Parise' 'Status:Unknown' and British thriller 'Welcome To Curiosity' (featuring Richard Blackwood). Then later in 2016, Luke wrote the music for Tomasz Szafranski's 'No Panic With a Hint of Hysteria' (Stephen Baldwin, Zbigniew Zamachowski), a fast paced hilarious black comedy described by some critics as Baldwin's best performance in decades. Recently, and between film breaks, Luke has composed the music for the opening of YiHaus in Shanghai - world's largest commercial shopping village. Since 2018 Luke co-manages Fizz-e-Motion, an international film distribution company comprising a music scoring and publishing department. with a catalogue of over 15 films and another five in production or development.
Stephen Kaiser-Pendergrast is known for his work on Weed (2015), Asylum (2014) and Bounty (2010).

Michaela was born on October 1st 1987 as Michaela Boakye-Collinson to Ghanaian parents and brought up in Tower Hamlets by her mother, a devout member of the Pentecostal church who instilled her religion into Michaela and her sister - something that she would later draw on for her play 'Chewing Gum Dreams. ' Already a poet and performance artist , releasing the album 'Fixing Barbie' in 2009, she obtained a 2.1 in English at university before enrolling at the Guildhall School of Music and Drama, where she was awarded the Laurence Olivier bursary, graduating in 2012. In 2013 she made her stage debut at the Bush Theatre, where she would perform 'Chewing Gum Dreams', later in the year transferring to the National Theatre, where she would return in 2014 to appear in 'Medea' with Helen McCrory. In 2015 a sitcom based on 'Chewing Gum Dreams', its title shortened to 'Chewing Gum' began its run on Channel 4 television and in 2016 she was back on that channel in another comedy-drama 'The Aliens'.

Sophie Colquhoun was born on September 12, 1989 in Liverpool, England. She is an actress and producer, known for Captain America - Il primo Vendicatore (2011), Finalmente maggiorenni (2011) and Plebs (2013).
Alice Macdonald is known for her work on Contracted - Fase I (2013), The Art of Storytelling (2019) and C'è sempre il sole a Philadelphia (2005).

Vanessa Kirby is an English stage, TV, and film actress. From 2016 to 2018, Kirby portrayed Princess Margaret in Peter Morgan's Netflix series The Crown, for which she won the BAFTA Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role in a Television Series in 2018. She starred as Estella in the BBC adaptation of Great Expectations, Joanna in Richard Curtis' romantic comedy About Time and Mission: Impossible - Fallout (2018). She is known mostly for her stage work, having won acclaim and awards for various productions, including Streetcar Named Desire with Ben Foster which transferred to New York; with Variety in 2016 called her "the outstanding stage actress of her generation, capable of the most unexpected choices." After MI6, she had a leading role in another action blockbuster, Fast & Furious - Hobbs & Shaw (2019)
Michele Lombardi is known for her work on Imperium (2016), Science Team (2014) and Return to Nuke 'Em High Volume 1 (2013).
Nathan Thomas Milliner is a writer and director, known for The Confession of Fred Krueger (2015), Star Wars: Hand of the Empire (2019) and Volumes of Blood (2015).
Joseph Lavender is an actor and writer, known for The Legend of Seven Toe Maggie (2015), Girls Against Humanity (2016) and The Marks.
Maisa Abd Elhadi was born on November 15, 1985 in Nazareth, Israel. She is an actress, known for L'angelo (2018), Baghdad Central (2020) and Sarah & Saleem - Là dove nulla è possibile (2018).
Travis Breedlove is a producer and actor, known for Headed South for Christmas (2013), Sarah's Friend (2015) and I'll Be Homeless for Christmas (2012).
Tomasz Schuchardt was born on September 18, 1986 in Starogard Gdanski, Pomorskie, Poland. He is an actor, known for W imie... (2013), Chemia (2015) and Ach spij kochanie (2017).
column6: September 18, 1986 in Starogard Gdanski, Pomorskie, Poland

column5: João Braz is known for his work on Mergulho no Ano Novo (1992), É o Amor (2013) and Noite Escura (2004).
Derek Huey is a cinematographer and editor, known for Stirring (2018), Cemetery Temple and Dave and Al's Strange Day (2015).
Leendert de Ridder is an actor, known for Mees Kees langs de lijn (2016), Malaika (2013) and Vrijland (2010).
Michalis Sarantis is an actor, known for Apostratos (2019), In the Strange Pursuit of Laura Durand (2019) and Logo timis: 20 hronia meta (2019).

George Clarke is the founder of independent film company, Yellow Fever Productions, based in Belfast, Northern Ireland. His duties in the film world are plentiful and his usual roles on his productions involve; writer, producer, director, action choreographer, DOP, editor, and some times, even actor. He created the Yellow Fever Independent Film Festival in 2008 and with his projects, has gained critical acclaim from industry professionals around the globe. George also runs the indie DVD label for Yellow Fever Productions in the UK and Ireland.Major influences in the film industry include Jackie Chan, Sammo Hung, Yuen Biao, Yuen Woo Ping, Donnie Yen and most major players in Asian cinema. His Western heroes consist of a mix of comedy greats, including Charlie Chaplin, Gene Wilder, Steve Martin and Mel Brooks.A father of 2, George is also a professional cartoonist/illustrator and spends his spare time at home creating a range of children's books and characters that he hopes to bring to the screen someday. His love for film is most evident upon witness of his 3000+ DVD collection.
Lukas Feigelfeld was born on December 19, 1986 in Vienna, Austria. He is a director and writer, known for Hagazussa (2017), Beton (2011) and Interferenz (2014).
Folco Terzani is a writer, known for La fine è il mio inizio (2010) and Le invasioni barbariche (2004).
Steve Dressler is an actor and writer, known for Alongside Night (2014), The Glass Circle and 1 Interrogation (2020).
Vasilis Katsikonouris is a writer and actor, known for To gala (2011).

Serhan Nasirli was born in 1980, in Istanbul. He graduated as BA from Maltepe University Cinema -Tv. After that, he went to Los Angeles and attended filmmaking course at New York Film Academy's Universal Studios. After working as a freelancer in various positions in these years, he founded own film company, MinusGreen Productions. In 2009 he started to produce and line produce local/foreign feature films, produced TV commercials and TV productions with MinusGreen Production.

Ashly Burch was born on June 19, 1990 in Phoenix, Arizona, USA as Ashly Syble Burch. She is an actress and writer, known for Life Is Strange (2015), Horizon Zero Dawn (2017) and L'attacco dei giganti (2013).
Darious Britt is known for his work on Unsound (2015), Making Unsound: The 7 Year Journey (2018) and Second Assault (2018).
Enoch Greenhood is known for his work on Three Sister's Laundry (2010) and Alien Domicile 2: Lot 24 (2018).
Evan Kimball Plochmann is a producer and director, known for Within (2016), I am Nowhere (2015) and Blank Fortune (2012).

Paul has graduated from The National University of Dramatic Arts in Bucharest,, I.L.Caragiale" in 2011 at the class of Florin Zamfirescu. From 2011 to 2013, Paul went for the master degree in acting at the class of Gelu Colceag at the University Of Dramatic Arts in Bucharest ,,I.L.Caragiale" . Paul is an advanced English speaker that activated for two years in the U.K. At present he is working in Bucharest as a freelancer. Paul has no siblings. Paul has no political views, he respects free inquiry and skeptical reasoning being a secular humanist.

Bailey Noble was born in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. She was raised there by her mother and father, Lynn and John Noble. She has one older sister, Casey Noble. Bailey is best known for portraying Adilyn Bellefleur on HBO's True Blood. She's also known for Amazon's The Last Tycoon, NBC's Law and Order True Crime: The Menendez Murders, and The Archer. Her most recent works include the feature film Flag Day and Amazon's Them: Covenant.

Selina Ringel is an award winning Writer, Producer & Comedian. Selina is Mexican/American and grew up in Guadalajara, Mexico. She is also Jewish. She has collaborated with incredible talent including Issa Rae ( INSECURE) , Lee Aronsohn ( TWO AND A HALF MEN), Salvador Paskowitz ( AGE OF ADELINE), Rob Schneider ( DEUCE BIGALOW, MALE GIGALOW). Selina has a strong eye for talent which is what drives all of her creative decisions. Her work has premiered and screened at many film festivals including Cannes Film Festival ( Section L'ACID), Cannes Shorts Corner, Tribeca, Clermont Ferrand and Cinequest film festival. Along with being in competition, Selina has also served as a guest judge for numerous festivals around the country. Selina was recently selected as one of twenty upcoming emerging Latino creators for the Tomorrow's Filmmakers Today program sponsored by HBO & The Academy, and has given master classes in collaboration with TEC DE Monterrey, Creator Up, Youtube, AT&T, Mitu Network, New York Film Academy and other educational programs. She participates heavily in a volunteer program called Art of Elysium. Her first feature film THE BEST PEOPLE which she wrote & produced was picked up by Samuel Goldwyn Films and got distributed worldwide, in the U.S. it is now available on Amazon Prime & Tubi. THE BEST PEOPLE also won the Special Jury Award for BEST COMEDY feature at WorldFest Houston and was the Closing Night film at Dances with Films. Selina also wrote, produced & starred in an eight episode comedy series called TUNING IN which is also now available on Amazon Prime. Selina is in the Groundlings program, she is also performing stand up regularly at clubs and bars including the Improv, The Ice House and The Comedy Store. She produces her own stand up comedy show once a month. Selina received her International Baccalaureate at Institute Le Rosey in Switzerland and her BA in Film Production at Loyola Marymount University. She also graduated with a Masters in Fine Arts from the Producing program at the AFI Conservatory in 2014. She is fluent in English, Spanish, French and Italian. She and her husband run their own production company, 2HANDS PRODUCTIONS.

Born in Tirana, Albania. He is a graduate of Albanian Economic University and University of Law. President of the "Albanian Producers and Filmmakers Association" Member of European Film Academy In 2011 he was selected for "Producers On The Move" in Cannes Film Festival, by European Film PromotionHe is Producer in "On Film Production" movies company. In 2019 "My Lake" ( producer) in 2018 "ZANA" (co-producer) In 2015, he will produce the movie "Distant Angels" by Gjergj Xhuvani In 2015"Alarm fur Cobra 11 - Vendetta (2015) TV episode (line producer) In 2013, he is executive produce the movie "Amsterdam Express" by Fatmir Koci In 2013, he is executive produce the movie "Amaneti" by Namik Ajazi In 2011, he produced 8 short movies: "Bela", "Sarina", "24 Hours", "Doors, doors", "The Lesson" "The Passion", "When the death turn the road", "Lucky letters" etc In 2010, he produced the movie "The Albanien" by Johannes Naber In 2010, he produced the TV movie "In search of !" by Gjergj Xhuvani In 2010, he produced 6 short movies: "Albania - Italy", "Family Market", "Heat", "Lost Days" "A night of bright weather", "Children Jobs"etc In 2009, he produced the TV sitcom "Komuna e Parisit" by Altin Basha In 2009, he worked as executive producer "Honey Moons " by Goran Paskaljevic In 2009, he produced 6 short movies: "The Farewell Waltz", "Horoscopes", "Money" "Hospital window, "Soldiers", "Two Friends" etc In 2008, he worked as executive producer "Alive" by Artan Minarolli In 2008, he produced 6 short movies: "The avenger's Family", "Parallel Life " "The Good, the Bad and the Ugly ", "The death of the grad father Trifon", "The first Day of the Job " "Beyond the Borders" "The Guests " In 2007, he worked as executive producer "Lenin and us " by Saimir Kumbaro

She was born in Kranj where she also attended high school. She first faced the theatre in the second year at Kranj Preseren's Theatre. Soon she got an episodic role in series One and A Half Star Hotel. After high school she enrolled at the Academy of Theatre, Radio, Film and Television (AGRFT). During her studies she was active in various projects outside the Academy; filmed several short films (Administrator, Trieste Is Ours, Srecko), TV drama (Our Democracy) and TV-movie (Hidden memory of Angela Vode). Her debut role in feature film was Nina in Lapajne's Personal Luggage. She cooperated with Nejc Gazvoda in feature films Dual and A Trip and Marko Santic's TV-film Seduce Me.
Ramajogayya Sastry is known for his work on Janatha Garage (2016), Dookudu (2011) and Bãhubali: The Beginning (2015).

A formidable talent working in NYC, Berlin and LA, Baldwin is known for her compelling, intricate narrative forms. As director, and frequent performer, she combines her penchant for dance and film to craft visceral stories and stylized dreamscapes. Chief among her tools are bold scores, rhythmic editing and the viewer's potential to embrace wonder.Her works have screened at all major festivals including Sundance, SXSW, and the Berlinale and have been exhibited around the world at galleries and museums including Lincoln Center, the V&A Museum, Miami Art Basel, and Carnegie Hall. Her shorts are featured on The Criterion Channel, Netflix, Filmmaker Magazine, Nowness and Vimeo Staff Pick.As a dancer, Baldwin performed on the world tour of David Byrne and Brian Eno's album "Everything That Happens Will Happen Today." Additional dance credits include The Metropolitan Opera Ballet, Trisha Brown Dance Company, among other NYC companies.Independent Magazine named her as one of "10 Filmmakers to Watch," Short of the Week compares her work to David Lynch, and The New York Times says her "work has a visceral power similar to Cronenberg's."
Jason Lei Howden is known for his work on Deathgasm (2015), Guns Akimbo (2019) and The War - Il pianeta delle scimmie (2017).
Haru Aoyama is an actress, known for Kimi ni todoke (2010), Sunôfurêku (2011) and Utsukushii rinjin (2011).
Stephane Lambert is a producer and writer, known for Instant BadAss, Me and My Beautiful Body (2019) and The Cave (2019).

Born and raised in Beatrice, Nebraska, Chris Lofing is the co-creator and co-owner of Tremendum Pictures. He started the California based film, television, commercial and viral marketing production company in 2011 with his friend and creative collaborator,Travis Cluff. Chris is a writer, director, editor and producer.
Keltie Squires is an actress, known for The Corrupted (2010), Heavy Metal Horror (2014) and Battleground (2011).

Ben is a British film director and screenwriter based in London, England. His debut feature, The Chamber, was a 'Suspenseful four-hander' (Sight & Sound) starring Force Majeure's Johannes Kuhnke, as the pilot of a four-man submarine trying to retrieve a US military drone from the seabed off the coast of North Korea. The film received a UK theatrical release from Studiocanal in 2017 and US release from Cinedigm and played the Glasgow International Film festival, Brussels BIFFF and Frightfest (among others) and streamed on Amazon Prime.After studying film in Leeds, Ben then made a career in film advertising, designing artwork for UK film campaigns. In 2011, his successful short film Shifter (described by Screen Daily UK as 'Superbly crafted with a killer twist') played Austin's Fantastic Fest and accompanied Ben Wheatley's film Kill List at FrightFest and in select London sites on release.Since his first feature, Ben has had one of his earlier scripts adapted into Travis Stevens's Girl on the Third Floor and is in development on a number of other projects, including a WWII thriller with Stigma Films and Fields Park Media.

Kara Killmer was born on June 14, 1988 in Texas, USA. She is an actress, known for Chicago Fire (2012), Chicago P.D. (2014) and Chicago Med (2015). She has been married to Andrew Cheney since May 14, 2016.
Knighten Richman is a director and writer, known for The Corrupted (2010), Errand Boy (2007) and Tisha and the Nog (2006).

He studied electrical engineering and business administration. He's been taking photograph since 1989. He had 2 solo, 8 group exhibitions and 6 shows. Some of his photographs were included to the collections of Istanbul Modern and Istanbul Photography Museum. His debut film called "White As Snow" was awarded 8 prizes at national and international festivals.Filmography "White As Snow", 2010 Book "Istanbul City of the Lodos Winds", 2008 Solo Exhibitions "Istanbul City of the Lodos Winds", 2010, "Istanbul Istanbul", 1998
Anita Gou is known for her work on Fino all'osso (2017), Transformers 4 - L'era dell'estinzione (2014) and Focus - Niente è come sembra (2015).

Brett interest in acting started early growing up in a small town in PA. At a very young age, he was inspired with films while working at the local movie theater. Later his passion for films transformed to acting while he understudied in the local performance of "The Outsiders." After high school, Brett joined the US Marines and after his service, was drawn to Los Angeles to pursue his acting career.Using his instincts along with the skills he developed during his service, he easily slid into military and police roles in big budget feature Captain America 2 as a shield strike agent, and the TV series Agents Of Shield, along with NCIS and HBO's True Blood.Brett has continued to evolve those roles into the hero of several short films making their way through the film circuit including upcoming film maker Kevin Linns: Snippets of Wally Watkins, Hero Sandwich and most recently in The Asylums latest feature, T-Minus releasing this summer. He also has just been featured in Better Criminal starring Tom Sizemore.Brett continues to grow in the industry is fast making a name for himself by bringing charisma and strength to each role he takes on.
Anna Altmann is an actress, known for Das Sommerhaus (2014), Nora (2013) and Ich habe dir nie erzählt, womit ich mein Geld verdiene (2011).
Jarrah Sexton is an actor and cinematographer, known for Reservoir Cats (2011), Man vs. Cross (2011) and Passion Love Beauty (2010).
Troy Halverson is an actor and producer, known for Demonica's Reign (2011), Evolution Creek (2012) and American Violence (2015).
John J. Welsh is an actor, known for Alien Showdown: The Day the Old West Stood Still (2018), The Snow Queen (2013) and Sleeping Beauty (2014).
Jeremy Hook is an actor and producer, known for The Corrupted (2010), Errand Boy (2007) and The Huntress (2005).
Kuljinder Singh Sidhu is an actor and writer, known for Sadda Haq (2013), Mini Punjab (2009) and Yoddha: The Warrior (2014).
Anuj Saraswat is an actor, known for The Corrupted (2010).

Sathish Krishnan was born on May 22, 1987 in Salem, Tamil Nadu, India. Sathish initially struggled quite a bit due to his relatively tall height for a comedian (1.79 m), as well as difficulty in obtaining acting offers due to his lack of connections with other directors. However, he changed his fate in 2013 in Ethir Neechal, and landed offers with many major Tamil superstars such as Dhanush and Vijay. This has made him one of the most sought after comedians and he has played award-winning roles in Kaththi (2014), Ethir Neechal (2013) and Vaagai Sooda Vaa (2011).
column6: May 17, 1987 in Salem, Tamil Nadu, India

column5: Adrian Powers is an Australian film director, screenwriter and editor. His work has screened in cinemas across the globe, including the 69th Venice Film Festival, where his film 'Scruples' screened as part of a special collaboration between Sir Ridley Scott, Michael Fassbender, Emirates and YouTube. Scott later commented that Adrian and his fellow finalists were "all clearly talents for the industry to watch".In 2013, Adrian completed work as co-director and editor on the WWI feature 'Forbidden Ground', which was released worldwide (including distribution in the U.S. via Lionsgate). He has edited thirteen feature films, including 'Skin Deep' (officially selected for the 2014 Austin Film Festival), 'Rip Tide' (released worldwide on Netflix in 2018), 'Paper Champions' (officially selected for CinefestOz 2020) and 'Romance on the Menu' (premiering as a Netflix film in 2020).In 2020, Adrian and his writing partner, Caera Bradshaw, advanced to the quarterfinals of Screencraft's annual drama screenplay competition, for their feature screenplay, 'Skylab Stan'. Adrian's latest film as writer and director, 'Brolga', has been successful at festivals both at home and internationally, and has garnered multiple 'Best Director' awards. He is currently developing his next feature directorial project alongside several TV projects.

John was born in Louisville, Kentucky and then raised in Riverton, Wyoming. He discovered acting while working as a National Park Ranger at Mammoth Cave National Park. John worked in regional theatre for years before accepting to train in classical theatre with The Old Globe in San Diego. He now lives in New York City.

As Juhana Lehtiniemi grew up in Lappajärvi, Finland, he didn't have too much to do with composing at the time. It was only after starting the studies in Kaustinen Music College when he got surrounded by all kinds of music projects. After some years in Tampere, Lehtiniemi got into studying jazz piano in Jyväskylä Educational Consortium. During this time he composed his first musical for symphonic orchestra, which encouraged him to apply to composition school in Birmingham, UK. Lehtiniemi received his Bachelor degree in composition and immediately started his film composition studies in a Master program in Stockholm Academy of Dramatic Arts, Sweden. The short film "Bekas" that he scored as his examination film won a Student Academy Award in 2011.
Adam Traynor is a director and actor, known for Ivory Tower (2010).
Sivakumar Palakrishnan is an actor and producer, known for The Noose (2007), Gurushetram: 24 Hours of Anger (2010) and A Yellow Bird (2016).

Marcelo Briem Stamm is a writer, screenwriter, director and producer born in Argentina. He is creating a series of productions focused on different angles of sexual diversity. His films have been distributed around the world, his new projects "Elton" and "Dandy" are participating on international film markets. All his stories have been adapted to narrative too.

column9: November 15, 2005 in Hausjärvi, Finland

column5: Caleb Ian Morley Fischer is an actor, known for The Corrupted (2010) and Soon by You (2015).

Antonio Padovan was born and raised in Venice, Italy. In 2007 he received a full scholarship to attempt a One-Year Program at the New York Film Academy and moved to the United States.He currently lives in New York and works as a writer and film director.In his films, he usually focuses on common people and ordinary problems. Most of his films have been shot in the West Village neighborhood of New York.
Shrabani Basu is known for her work on Vittoria e Abdul (2017), Spy Princess and Sky News Tonight (2014).

Joseph Mensch is a director and producer known for Bushwick (2017), Asher (2018) and Caviar (2020). Born in New York City, he studied film at Cornell and worked as a production assistant for Martin Scorsese before directing the short film The Velvet Hammer. Joe's first feature, Caviar, comes out this year.
Charlie Keegan is an actor, known for 6-Headed Shark Attack (2018), Skoonheid (2011) and About Time (2017).

Graduated from Art Center College of Design with a BFA in Film Editing in 2013. Editor of successful narrative, commercial, and music video pieces. Began editing in high school when he took a television production class and moved to Los Angeles in 2007 to take a shot being a writer. After re-visiting non-linear editing he found that it was the happy medium between crafting characters and technology.

Juliana Harkavy is an American actress of Dominican, Russian, African, Chinese, and Hungarian descent. Born on New Years Day in New York City and raised in Los Angeles, Harkavy has been appearing in theater, film, and television since the age of nine. Juliana was born to mother Berta Carela, an artist, writer, and educator from Santo Domingo, and father Michael Harkavy, a Brooklyn native, also a writer, publisher, and athlete. Her only sibling, August, is thirteen years her junior. Juliana's passions were always based in the arts. She grew up playing music from the age of three, studying piano, guitar, voice, and flute. She also began writing and publishing music, stories, and poetry, as well as creating mixed-media visual art at a very young age. With a second passion for athletics and dance, she was able to create a balanced craft that would later prepare her for physically demanding roles, such as ex-military survivor Alicia in AMC's "The Walking Dead", and iconic comic book character Dinah Drake/The Black Canary on The CW's "Arrow". Harkavy studied theater under the Meisner studio at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. Other working titles include: Two Streets Entertainment's "To Write Love on Her Arms", Warner Bros.' "Dolphin Tale", and "Dolphin Tale 2", NBC's "Constantine", and an award-winning performance as rookie detective Jessica Loren in Magnolia Picture's "Last Shift." Harkavy resides in Los Angeles, CA with her husband and partner of ten years, Peter. Together they share a deep passion for animal rescue, with a focused interest in pit bulls.
column6: January 1, 1985 in New York City, New York, USA
column8: New York City, New York, USA

column5: Jean Elie is a Haitian American actor/producer, known for playing Ahmal Dee on HBO's critically acclaimed comedy series Insecure. Elie rose to recognition as an actor for playing Yves Durand in the 2017 limited drama series American Crime, before attaining his most prominent role as Issa Rae's brother, Ahmal Dee on Insecure.Other credits include BET holiday drama film Throwback Holiday, horror film The Final Wish, digital series Giants, Rider, and Black Girl in Big Dresses, voiceover on animated series Alvin and the Chipmunks, and short drama films Thin Walls, Detour, and A Gentleman Always.
Master Bharath is an actor, known for Pokiri (2006), Dookudu (2011) and Nippu (2012).
Eric LeBlanc is an actor and writer, known for End Trip (2018), My B.F.F. (2016) and W.I.N.O. (2013).
Vytautas Vysniauskas is a cinematographer and actor, known for Paskutiniai Bremeno muzikantai (2005), Geltonu plytu kelias (1993) and Dievu miskas (2005).
Laura Hand is an actress and writer, known for I Am Not My Home (2014), Il passato non dimentica (2016) and Fouetté (2017).
Ikuko Kawai is a composer, known for Kita no kanaria-tachi (2012), Middonaito basu (2017) and Torocco (2009).
Takahiro Fujimoto is an actor, known for Jin (2009), Sanadamaru (2016) and Neet Neet Neet (2018).

Born and raised in England, James traveled to America in 2008 to undertake a one year film making diploma at The New York Film Academy in New York City. There James learned about all the different techniques of visual storytelling including directing, cinematography, and post-production.Whilst at film school James wrote, directed, and edited eight of his own short films and crewed over 30 other films made by his classmates. It was also at film school where James was often the Script Supervisor on his classmates films.After graduating in 2009 James remained in New York City for a few months and did freelance work on many films, including as a gaffer on the award winning feature film 'Frog Dreams'.Most of this freelance work was as a Script Supervisor were he honed his skills in that important crew role.In summer 2009 James returned to England to continue his film career. He has written and directed many short films that have won awards and been accepted into film festivals worldwide. James has also continued to be a Script Supervisor and now has feature film, short film, green screen studio film and 3D experience. James also undertook further training for the role by undertaking Script Supervision and Continuity for Film & Television workshop at The London Film School.
Darius Auzelis is an actor, known for Redirected (2014), Ekskursante (2013) and Tamangai (1995).
Jerica Henline is known for her work on Polycarp (2015), Dietro la maschera (2015) and The Forgotten Martyr: Lady Jane Grey (2011).
Yûho Yamashita is an actress, known for Jukai - La foresta dei suicidi (2016), Take Down (2016) and Fonotune: An Electric Fairytale (2018).
Iraida Sokolova is an actress, known for Osobennosti russkoy bani (1999).
Michel Aboudib is known for his work on Spin (2011), Deux par deux (2010) and Rise of the Fellowship (2013).

Krishna Chaitanya is a Telugu lyricist, writer and director. He mainly works as a lyricist for the Telugu film industry. Krishna Chaitanya debuted with writing songs for Sambhavami yuge yuge but his first big break came with the film Yuvatha in which he penned all the songs. In his career, the lyrics he penned for the songs in the movies Ishq and Gunde Jari Gallantayyinde bought critical acclaim.Krishna Chaitanya made his directorial debut in the film Rowdy Fellow starring Nara Rohit and Vishakha Singh
Han Han was born on September 23, 1982 in Shanghai, China. He is an actor and writer, known for Hou hui wu qi (2014), Fei chi ren sheng (2019) and Cheng feng po lang (2017).
Riyaana Hartley is a producer and director, known for Batgirl Rises (2015), Girl of Steel: Fan Film (2014) and The Grandmaster.
Walter Taylaur is a director and writer, known for The Wages (2013), Gbomo Gbomo Express (2015) and Catch.er (2017).
Vineet Sinha is a producer and editor, known for For Here or to Go? (2015), Meet the Drapers (2017) and According to Plan A (2012).

Bradley's true motivation in pursuing film has always been focused on sharing message through story. His creative abilities have proven to be both resourceful and effective in telling story. Through the use of lighting & shadows, colour & tone, and space & movement he aims to employ his techniques to create an emotionally charged visual stage to place the art within a story.

Thomas Leveritt is half-American and half-British. He is a novelist and screenwriter. His first novel, The Exchange Rate Between Love and Money was hailed as 'dazzling' by The Guardian and won both a Betty Trask Award for a first novel and a Somerset Maugham Award from the Society of Authors. He is also an award winning artist.
Franciszek Dziduch is an actor, known for Po prostu przyjazn (2016), Klub wlóczykijów (2015) and Apetyt na zycie (2010).

Joshua Chase Delozier was born on April 29, 1983 in Vista, California. Josh is the only child but has two half brothers and sisters. He grew up in rural North County San Diego graduating from Valley Center High School in 2001. In 2007, Delozier graduated Chico State University carrying a Bachelors degree in Social Sciences. On the way to become a high school teacher, Josh was discovered by a local modeling scout. Delozier's depth went deeper than still pictures. He began acting classes shortly after. Josh is most known for his lead role as Daniel "La Llorona III"

Priscilla Nzimiro Nwanah has over 10 years of experience in the television industry, Producing/Directing Television format shows including Project Fame West Africa, Nigerian Idol, Malta Guinness street dance and several independent productions that have been broadcast Pan-Africa wide. For the last 5 years, she has worked as a Senior Producer/Director for Africa's 1st Global Black entertainment channel, EbonyLifeTV, where she has created and produced many programs ranging from reality to lifestyle entertainment including The Fattenning Room, Sistaz, Tiannah's Empire, Wardrobe Diaries, Chefrican and many more. Her debut film as a Producer, The Royal Hibiscus hotel, was a selected and screened at the 2017 Toronto International Film Festival. Most recently, she also produced the highest grossing Nollywood film, The Wedding Party 2: Destination Dubai. She co-founded the "She Rocks" brand which was created to celebrate women in media, arts and entertainment. Starting as a weekly event showcase of upcoming female artist and honoring powerful women, it has evolved into other media channels, products and markets. At her core, Priscilla is a consummate artist. A documentary filmmaker and video artist. Priscilla continues to break the boundaries of female stereotypes in Africa. Her works explore through audio and visual means, topics that focus on our ecology and social environment.

Milan Maric studied at the Faculty of Dramatic Arts in Belgrade. He took to the stage at a young age, acting with the youth group «Dadov» and at other professional theaters in Serbia as well as at the Yugoslav Drama Theatre, Belgrade. Maric starred in several successful shorts and had supporting roles in a number of Serbian feature films. He has received an immense success with his lead role in Alexei German's Dovlatov, which received Silver Bear at Berlinale and earned him the Chopard Talent Award (2018), at Moscow Film Festival.

Pavel "Bulldozer" Lubanski, is an Actor, Animator and Comedy Writer, currently based out of Ottawa, Canada. Currently making waves with his new exposure in the entertainment industry, he initially had an online reputation for creating hundreds of the most raunchy, awkward, weird cartoons, under the alias of Junkyard Animations. Most popular for rude point-and-click flash games like, "Fuck Mr. Hatcher", (featured on Game Grumps) and Attack Of The Giant Penises, (featured on Newgrounds), Junkyard Animations has many viral creations spreading their filth across the web.With the Mr. Hatcher characters becoming popularized online, they have recently been featured in a Horror film, titled Monster Pool 3. They appear in a segment animated by Pavel Lubanski, titled "The Deviant", produced by Pavel's Business Partner, Jon Marin.Pavel has been an entertainer his whole life, making everyone around him laugh. After being voted the Class Clown of his Highschool, he took it upon himself to share his humor with the World. He started up his own website JunkyardAnimations.com (2006), where he'd create his own cartoons and games, which struck popularity with the fans of Newgrounds. Pavel's website received 2.4 million views, it's first 3 years of being launched and he also created a game titled 'Attack Of The Giant Penises' which has over 1.2 million hits to date. Several cartoon shorts sit with over 750 000 views, and Pavel has had content featured on MTV Live, Game Grumps, Newgrounds, Aniboom, SpikedHumor and TSN1200.Pavel didn't just want to be some voice behind his cartoons, he wanted to eventually get on the big screen and be seen and heard by everyone. Deciding to follow his dreams of becoming an Actor, Pavel contacted local casting agency's, directors, agents, producers, crew members and actors in the Ottawa area. He was finally cast as an extra in a YTV series titled Family Biz (2009) and from that moment on, he's appeared as an extra in multiple big budget movies, had speaking roles in local independent movies and commercials and is landing new opportunities as they appear.He still has a long way to go, but maybe one day this World will know of the name Pavel Lubanski!
Kevin Johnson is a producer and actor, known for The Medic (2013), Hoodoo Voodoo (2010) and Thousand Yard Stare (2018).

Very fetching and slender brunette Megan Medellin was born on January 18, 1992 in Las Vegas, Nevada. Megan was the Playboy Cybergirl of the Week for the first week of May, 2010. Medellin not only has done a bunch of additional nude shoots for Playboy, but also was featured in a couple of episodes of the TV series Badass! (2010). She was eventually voted Playboy's Cybergirl of the Month for September, 2012. In addition, Megan has also appeared in a few films and TV shows. A fast food junkie, Medellin makes crafts and writes poetry in her spare time.

Paul Griffin is a producer and director, known for Camping With Shondra Foxx (2014), 11:43 (2011) and The Inhaler (2012).
Chris Miera was born in 1986 in Schwedt, Brandenburg, Germany. He is known for his work on Ein Weg (2017), Die Kraft die bleibt (2016) and Geteilt (2013).
Mark Eacersall is a writer and actor, known for Tragédie Grouick (2009), À la maison pour Noël (2011) and Pop Redemption (2013).

T.C. Stallings is a former professional athlete now finding success in film and television. After stunning football campaigns in both high school and college, T.C. went on to play professionally in the Arena, Europe, and Canadian leagues. Following his success in athletics, T.C.'s desires shifted to a career in film and television. In 2004, T.C. landed a spot on Animal Planet's King of the Jungle, a hit network reality television show in which he emerged as the season 2 champion. He then began a 4 year stint working with Russell Athletic as a fitness model. In 2008-after a successful Skype audition from the living room of his Louisville, KY home- TC made his feature film debut in the 2011 hit movie, "Courageous" portraying the memorable character, "TJ". Following this feat, TC gave up a successful personal training business in Louisville and headed for Hollywood. After a few months of auditioning, TC would land two commercials, followed by three more film roles. But TC's career reached new heights with his break-out performance as "Tony Jordan" in the 2015 hit film, "War Room", which soared to #1 at the box office. He would later land a nomination for Best Actor at the ICFF for his lead role in "God's Compass", followed by a Best Actor win at the CFF for his supporting role in "Unbridled". TC also found continual success in booking TV commercials, with two of them being featured during the 2016 Rio Olympics and the 2016 Superbowl. In 2019, his company (Team TC Productions) reached a milestone when TC wrote, directed and self-produced a documentary called "24 Counter: The Story Behind the Run", which was nominated for "Most Inspirational Documentary" by the ICFF. TC is a wide-ranging actor, a huge advocate for clean family entertainment, and enjoys creatively getting involved in philanthropic efforts around the world.

Jenna Kanell delivered a TEDx Talk titled "A Bee Showed Me That Limits Are Lies" inspired by her vanguard short film "Bumblebees," which after its festival run has assisted in schools and festivals around the world to encourage dialogue on disabilities and compassion. She's written and directed other short films, commercials, and call to action videos. She's a union actor (in films such as "The Front Runner," "Terrifier," & "The Bye Bye Man,") and stunt performer who trains in Krav Maga. Jenna is arguably proudest of teaching her cat to do tricks.

Upcoming actress, Alyssa Steinacker is best known for her role as Sonya Stecko in Don't Come Back from the Moon (2017).Alyssa Elle Steinacker was born on May 2nd, 1998 in Port Charlotte, Florida, to Sueanne Edan Steinacker, a talent rep., and Gregg Steinacker, a general contractor. She has a younger sister, Madison Marie Steinacker - both girls were adopted at birth.Ever since the young age of four, Alyssa has been inspired by the performing arts, begging her parents to put her in multiple dance and vocal classes throughout her childhood. Her love for acting wasn't discovered until she was nearly 9-years old when she was put into a musical theater class, where she learned basic theater terminology, how to deliver a monologue, and how to sing and dance at the same time. Rooted in the musical theater class, Alyssa Steinacker's love for acting developed into a curiosity about TV and film acting. With support from both her parents, Alyssa began studying at John Robert Powers, Tampa, FL, where she then signed up for a widely-known talent showcase called IPOP! This showcase is where she landed her first manager, who strongly encouraged Alyssa and her family to move across the country to pursue an acting career in California.Shortly thereafter, Alyssa began booking commercials and supporting roles in films. Finally, she landed her first leading role as Lisa Marie Dawson in Broken Angels. In this indie drama, her single Step Away is featured, and she began developing a music career from there, working with Aaron Anderson, Sam Saltzer, and Andrew Lane. Her music got her an award for Pop Artist of the Year by The LA Music Awards 25th Anniversary, hosted by Al Bowman. Alyssa Steinacker's most recent films include Those Left Behind (2016), where she plays opposite of Nickelodeon's Jack Griffo and alongside Daphne Zuniga and Michael Hogan, and Don't Come Back from the Moon (2017) with James Franco, Rashida Jones, Jeff Wahlberg.Alyssa Elle Steinacker can also be seen in No Tomorrow (2012), The Zeroes (2014), and Crazy Bitches (2014).
Sophia Sebiskveradze is an actress, known for My Dad's Girlfriend (2011), The Confession (2017) and Two Psychos (2018).
Leonora Lim-Moore is an actress and writer, known for Made in Taiwan (2015), East (2011) and Hear the Doors (2013).

Stelana Kliris is a writer and director known for Committed.She also produced award-winning director Tonia Mishiali's feature debut Pause and is developing several new projects under her company Meraki Films. She has a background in editing and production on international film and commercial productions. She has previously written and directed two short documentaries and two short narrative films, winning an award for her first short The Fiddler.She is inspired by stories with heart and humanity and has a wealth of tales from her multi-cultural upbringing in countries with complicated political situations, like South Africa and Cyprus.

(b. 1988, Peru) Nicolás Wong Díaz has been making feature films as a cinematographer since 2010 in Costa Rica, Guatemala and México. She is the middle sister of Justin Qualley and Sarah Margaret Qualley.Rainey began her dancing career at the age of two. She was Miss Golden Globe in 2012. In 2015, Rainey made her musical debut under the name "Rainsford".

Producer at Volition Media Partners. Jefferson oversees the company's day to day operations, it's development slate and physical production.He has produced and executive produced a number of independent feature films including Not Without Hope, the incredible true story of Nick Schuyler starring Miles Teller, the action thriller, Infamous, starring Bella Thorne, Jake Manley and Amber Riley, the civil rights drama, Son of the South, executive produced by Spike Lee and starring Lucas Till, Lucy Hale, Cedric the Entertainer, Julia Ormond and the late Brian Dennehy, the sci-fi thriller, Zone 414, starring Guy Pearce, Travis Fimmell and Matilda Lutz, The Paper Store, starring Penn Badgley, Stef Dawson and Richard Kind and the psychological thriller, Let Me Make You A Martyr, starring Niko Nicotera, Sam Quartin, Mark Boone Junior and Marilyn Manson.

Felipe Vara de Rey is a Madrid-born, Brooklyn-based cinematographer and director.After obtaining a degree in political science in 2002, he worked for a few years doing social research, but soon shifted gears and went on to graduate in cinematography from Madrid's Film Institute. He also attended an International Workshop on feature screenwriting at EICTV, in San Antonio de los Baños (Cuba). Thanks to a Fulbright Scholarship, Felipe moved to NYC in 2011 to pursue NYU's Graduate Film program, where now - after graduating in 2016 - he also serves as an adjunct professor of cinematography.Felipe's body of work, both as a cinematographer and a director, includes commercials, music videos and art films; however, he's recently been focusing on narrative projects. In May of 2019, Netflix released the original film 'See You Yesterday', executive produced by Spike Lee, which Felipe lensed for director Stefon Bristol. 'Nosotros' was his feature-length directorial debut.Felipe is represented worldwide by Gersh.
Francis Milton is an actor, known for Hollywood Salome (1998).

Rubaiyat Hossain is one of Bangladesh's handful of female filmmakers, known for her critically acclaimed debut feature film Meherjaan (2011) which faced political and cultural wrath in Bangladesh for its anti war narrative, and its critic of masculine nationalism from a feminine point of view. Her second feature film Under Construction (2015) premiered at New Directors Showcase at Seattle International Film festival and was theatrically released and well received in Bangladesh. Her third feature film Made in Bangladesh (2019), premiered at Toronto International Film Festival and distributed by Pyramide Films. Rubaiyat uses a feminist lens to deconstruct the otherwise phallocentric institution of cinema. Rubaiyat has completed her B.A. in Women Studies from Smith College, USA and M.A. in South Asian Studies from University of Pennsylvania. Currently she lives between Dhaka and New York making films and attending Tisch School of Arts at New York University in Cinema Studies.

Chase Wainscott has been acting since he was 5, when he landed his first feature film role as Young Rob, in Renzo Vasquez's The Box Cutter. Since then, he has traveled the world working on projects in film, television, commercials and music videos. He can be seen on CMT in Sun Records playing Knox Phillips, son of Sam Philips (Chad Michael Murray), and as Peter Montgomery on the OWN network in Tyler Perry's If Loving You is Wrong. You can also see him on numerous national and international commercials. Chase loves working on set with new people, facing challenging roles, and getting to play all sorts of interesting characters. When he is not on set, you can find him playing soccer, kayaking, or volunteering at his favorite animal shelter where he met his 2 huskies.

Feature Film: Vodka Diaries (Released by AA Films & available on Netflix & Amazon Prime). It featured Kay Kay Menon, Raima Sen & Mandira Bedi as the leads. The film was highly appreciated by critics like Komal Nhata, Subhash K Jha & Taran Adarsh. Veteran filmmaker JP Dutta did the muhurat of the film and filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj did the music release of the film. Veteran film makers like Vishal Bhardwaj, Imtiyaz Ali and Ashutosh Gowarikar also came forward to support his film Vodka diaries.Produced short film The Job (Featuring Kalki Koechlin - Nominated for Filmfare Best Short Film 2019).Directed short film Kaafir (Awarded Best Short film by Mr. Aamir Khan).Learnt the art of filmmaking from Mr. JP Dutta & Mr. Anurag Basu.Director & Produced more than 100 Ad films shot all over the world.He had served Indian Air Force for 7 years as Non Commissioned Officer in Logistics department from Dec 1999 to Apr 2006 hence.

Dustin J. Robison is a Filmmaker based in Las Vegas, NV, born in Seattle, WA. Twelve years ago, he began his career by exploring the world of indie films. Soon after his first short film, he turned his focus from illustration to filmmaking and hasn't looked back. He studied cinematography at Full Sail University, under James Neihouse, ASC, and is now the co-owner of the esteemed production company, Quantum Arc Media. For the last twelve years, he has focused on honing his skills as a cinematographer through experience and formal education, mastering the technical aspects of creating beautiful imagery and visual storytelling. He is a storyteller at heart who has gravitated to the the medium of film to portray his narratives. After directing many short films across a variety of genres, he has finally begun his directorial debut with his first feature film, The Christmas Cabin.

Tanaji Dasgupta is an Indian producer and actor based in Mumbai and Kolkata. He is the writer and producer of The Hungry - an adaptation of William Shakespeare's Titus Andronicus. The film is being funded by Film London and Cinestaan (India) and written / directed by Bornila Chatterjee. As a producer, he is also developing Nuclear Hearts (written and directed by Bornila Chatterjee, co-produced by OddJoint, India and Dolce Vita Films, France). From 2011 to 2014, he was the Executive Producer of OddJoint (formerly called Overdose Joint), an independent film production company headed by Q (the acclaimed director of Gandu and Brahman Naman) and Celine Loop. Tanaji is the executive producer of Ludo (dir: Q, Nikon/2015), Kajarya (dir: Madhureeta Anand/2013) and Tasher Desh (dir: Q/2012). He has worked as the line producer on Sold (directed by Oscar-winner Jeffrey D Brown, 2014) and as the assistant director on Chittagong (dir: Bedabrata Pain/2012), The Waiting City (dir: Claire McCarthy, 2009) and The Japanese Wife (dir: Aparna Sen, 2010).
Paula del Río is an actress, known for Desconocido - Resa dei conti (2015), Cordes (2019) and Servir y proteger (2017).
Liel Danir is an actress, known for Tel-Aviv Location (2009), Malachiyot BeLavan (2012) and Hitganvut Yehidim (2010).

Coskun Cetinalp is an actor, known for Söz (2017), Çiçero (2019) and The Circle Within (2013).

Stephen Dixon was born Oct 19, 1973 in Ocilla, GA. He grew up in Fitzgerald, GA and graduated Fitzgerald High School in 1993. During and after highschool, he played in local bands and traveled to Florida to open concerts at small venues. In 1995, Stephen joined the United States Marine Corps and trained at Parris Island then went to Camp Lejeune, NC for further training at the School of Infantry. He then went to Marine Corps Logistics Base, Albany, GA where he served for 7 years. While stationed here, he received multiple meritorious promotions and medals and was selected as Marine of the Year. After Sept 11th, Stephen (now a Sergeant was sent to Camp Lejeune and served with the 24th Marine Expeditionary Unit and was deployed to Iraq. He served in the Babil Province in the area known as the "Triangle of Death". During this deployment he served in a special operations platoon that conducted Counter Mortar patrols around the area of Forward Operating Base Kalsu. For his superior performance, he was awarded a Navy & Marine Corps Achievement Medal for Combat Operations. After returning to the United States, Stephen was transferred to an infantry unit, 1st Battalion, 6th Marines. He served in the capacity of Infantry Platoon Sergeant and Infantry Platoon Commander while deployed to Iraq again, this time in Ramadi. Stephen was an ECP Commander for his unit and was awarded the Navy & Marine Corps Commendation Medal with the Combat "V" for his heroic actions. During his two deployments to Iraq, Stephen taught himself how to read, write and speak Arabic so after his second deployment, he was sent to Monterey, CA to attend the Arabic Linguist Course. Upon graduation, he was sent back to Camp Lejeune, NC and deployed to Afghanistan. Prior to deploying to Afghanistan, Stephen auditioned for the movie "Exit 101" by Joseph Lavender and they quickly became good friends and have worked on multiple movie projects there after. Stephen has been a Producer on 3 of Joseph's movies thus far and has had bit parts in each of those. On the set of "the Legend of Seven Toe Maggie" by Joseph Lavender, Stephen met Chris Maney and Samantha Katelyn and began a working relationship with them as well while operating out of North Carolina. Through his connections with some of his cast mates and casting agents, Stephen was offered an opportunity to work on "Iron Man 3" and had the unique privilege of working along side with Robert Downey, Jr during the Afghan Border scenes. These scenes were cut from the theatrical release but it was a great opportunity and a career high for Stephen.
