N.K. Pant is an actor, known for Manjhi: The Mountain Man (2015), Pairon Talle (2010) and Siddharth (2013).
Damien Bonnard was born on July 22, 1978 in Alès, Gard, France. He is an actor, known for I miserabili (2019), Dunkirk (2017) and Rester vertical (2016).
Ian Manson was born on November 2, 1969 in Stroud, Gloucestershire, England. He is a producer and actor, known for United in Lockdown (2020), In Circles (2016) and Skinny Buddha.
column6: November 2, 1969 in Stroud, Gloucestershire, England, UK

column5: Kyle Fischer was born on July 13, 1978 in Salem, Oregon, USA. He is known for his work on Manson Family Vacation (2015), Hot Air (2016) and Ape (2017). He has been married to Rheanne Fischer-Moore since August 27, 2010.

Tyler Collins was born in Anchorage in Alaska. He studied at an arts boarding school having been awarded a scholarship. It was whilst studying acting at the school that he learned about the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland after a deputation from staff members of the institution. Whilst studying stage acting at the Conservatoire he met and formed a close working relationship with John McPhail and Andrew Lanni.After finishing his studies, Collins starred in a number of short films including Dear Mom (2010) in which McPhail was the cinematographer of the film. He also played the character Luke on several occasions in the BBC television series River City (2002). In 2013, Collins was invite to play the lead role of Adam in the short film Notes (2013) about a pair of roommates whose relationship develops through a series of post it notes. Collins performance would later go on to be rewarded with the Best Actor accolade at the 2013 edition of the We Like 'Em Short Film Festival in Oregon.In the summer of 2013, Collins played the lead role of the Boy in Just Say Hi (2013) which was made for the 2013 edition of the Virgin Media Short Awards. The film went on to win 2 out of the 3 awards at a prestigious awards ceremony in London attended by Collins and the production team.In 2015, Collins took on his biggest role to date as the leading character of James in the feature film Where Do We Go From Here? (2015). Shot in just 16 days, the film centres around the newly instated Nurse Jen of the 'Easy Love Care Home' who questions why the 25-year-old James is living and working in the care home. The film appeared at the 2015 edition of the Sydney Indie Film Festival where it was nominated for 7 awards with Collins receiving nominations for Best Actor and for Best Score as the films composer. Collins later went on to win the Best Score accolade. The film is due to appear at the 2016 edition of the Glasgow Film Festival.
Abhishek Banerjee is a casting director and actor, known for Stree (2018), Rang De Basanti (2006) and Dream Girl (2019).
Gustavo Beck is a producer and director, known for O Inverno de Zeljka (2013), Zimsko cudo (2012) and O Arquipélago (2014).
Alex Anthony is an actor, known for Buffering (2011).
Lamar Johnson is known for his work on Il coraggio della verità - The Hate U Give (2018), Kings (2017) and The Next Step (2013).

Garrett Backstrom was born October 25, 1995 in Colorado Springs, Colorado, to Elizabeth and Gary Backstrom. He was raised in a Christian household and is strong in his faith. Between the ages of three to thirteen, Garrett was a competitive gymnast and trained at the Olympic Training Center. He won two back-to-back Colorado State Championships and dreamed of going to the Olympics. His dreams took him in another direction due to multiple injuries. Having a passion for filmmaking from a very young age, Garrett's next pursuit took him to California where he pursued his ambitions for filmmaking and acting. His parents placed him in independent studies for one semester to test the waters. Soon after booking multiple gigs and getting very positive feedback from his agency, one semester turned into a film career for Garrett.From 2010-2014, he starred in a handful of shows and movies including - "Brothers & Sisters" (2011), "Lab Rats" (2012), "Jesse" (2012), "Hello Herman" (2012), "Motel Life" (2012), and "Summer Snow" (2014). Garrett attended Brighton Hall, was elected student body president, developed leadership skills, and fostered long-standing relationships with many in the film industry. In 2014 he decided to put his acting career on hold to master film production at Loyola Marymount University. During those four years, Garrett spent his spare time freelancing as a director, producer, and cinematographer. He worked on a variety of commercials, music videos, and narrative productions. At the age of 22, he directed an automotive commercial for the largest Maserati dealership in North America, a fashion campaign commercial for a luxury street-style brand "Revelatiant," and four narrative short films. He also acted in two feature films while attending college, "Late Bloomer" (2016) and "Bad Impulse" (2020). He graduated from the School of Film and Television at LMU in 2018.After graduating from Loyola Marymount University, Garrett has focused his attention on narrative film and television. His passion for directing and producing drove him to partner with Ethan Terra and join his production company Optx Entertainment as a producer. Garrett continues to foster and develop new relationships and skills as an upcoming film director, producer, and actor.
Stelios Xanthos is known for his work on Don Verdean (2015), Cyborg X (2016) and Peloton (2012).
Jessica Matthews is an actress, known for Buffering (2011) and The Protege (2010).

Njel de Mesa (full name: Nathaniel de Mesa) is an award-winning writer-director, singer-songwriter, viral video artist and producer in the Philippines. His notable works include: KontrAdiksyon (starring Jake Cuenca, Kris Bernal, Katrina Halili, Ritz Azul etc.), Respeto, and Subtext.He was also trained in Production design by Philippines' National Artist for Production Design, Salvador Bernal and is a multi-Palanca Award winning writer. He holds influential positions in the entertainment industry working with Universal Records and BELL films and being a part of the board of directors of ALIW awards (Philippines' Premiere Award-giving body for Live Entertainment), FILSCAP, the Movie Television Review and Classification Board, a trainer-director in PAGCOR (Philippine Amusement and Gaming Corporation) Entertainment Department, and NDMstudios.
Luke Guldan is an actor and producer, known for The Good Place (2016), Broad City (2014) and Tell Me a Story (2018).

Rick Craft is an emerging young director/cinematographer with an eye for the eerily ironic. His work includes several MTV videos in which he either directed or was director of photography and a video promotional campaign for the iconic Von Dutch clothing brand. Dovetailing his career in film are his continuing projects as a fashion photographer. Heavily influenced by cinematic presence, his photos, like his film and video work, are all at the same time colorful, emotional, hyper and when the mood and work requires it, beautifully creepy. Numerous fashion shoots include a six page fashion spread of rapper Rye Rye in Status Magazine; an ever-growing celebrity portfolio that includes Miley Cyrus, Kelly Osbourne for Disney, Danny Trejo, Chanel West Coast and others; and editorial feature photos in Vogue Italia and V Magazine.
Catherine Libert is an editor and actress, known for Les champs brûlants (2010), Rouge, le portrait mensonger de Bertrand Bonello (2015) and Des provinces lointaines (2015).
Conner Mckenzy is an actor and producer, known for Soho Jimbo (2016), Checking In (2014) and How to Be a Villain (2015).
Miloslav Halík was born on February 4, 1955 in Prague, Czechoslovakia. He is a composer and actor, known for Decibely lásky (2016), Vrat se do hrobu! (1990) and Schritte im Labyrinth (1990).
column6: February 4, 1955 in Prague, Czechoslovakia [now Czech Republic]

column5: Floyd Abel is an actor, known for The Watermen (2012).
Blakely Bunnell is an actress, known for The Watermen (2012) and The Senior Prank (2014).

Under the name Deru, Ben is signed to the label Mush Records and has released three albums, as well as many remixes and compilations for labels such as Merck and Ghostly International. His style might be best described as an amalgam of hip-hop and electronica, and under this name Ben plays live in clubs and festivals in the U.S. and Europe.Ben grew up in Chicago, where his earliest influences came across the airwaves of the legendary University of Chicago radio station WHPK, and JP-Chill. Listening to hip-hop, and specifically its use of static in music, prompted Ben's first forays into manipulating sound. By high school, Ben had become a fixture around the station, which earned him an invitation from JP-Chill to try his hand at some on-air mixes. He was sold.He continued his sonic explorations at the California Institute of the Arts, where he studied synthesis, signal processing, acoustics, music theory, and composition, and earned a bachelor's degree in music technology. While at CalArts, Ben also delved into world music, studying Balinese gamelan, African drumming and hand percussion. Ben's multi-layered musical sensibility combines hip-hop, electronic, world music and classical composition.In 2007, Ben collaborated with composer Joby Talbot on the score to Wayne McGregor's ballet, Genus, based on Charles Darwin's theory of evolution, commissioned by the Paris Opera Ballet. The ambitious eight-part score combines electronics with 10-part choir, and string instruments. That score is available on Ant-Zen and Dear Oh Dear Records.
Nolberto Sánchez is an actor, known for Los colores de la montaña (2010).

Anna Meredith is a composer, producer and performer of both acoustic and electronic music. Her sound is frequently described as 'uncategorisable' and 'genre-defying' and straddles the different worlds of contemporary classical, art pop, electronica and experimental rock - or as The Guardian described it "majestic bangers".Her music has been performed everywhere from the BBC Last Night of the Proms to flashmob body-percussion performances in the M6 services, PRADA & Fendi fashion campaigns, numerous films, installations and documentaries, pop festivals, clubs and classical concert halls worldwide and broadcast on Radio 1, 2, 3, 4 & 6.Her debut album, Varmints was released in March 2016 on Moshi Moshi/PIAS to huge critical acclaim with numerous 4 and 5 star reviews from press and media around the World including Pitchfork's coveted Best New Music. Varmints was Loud & Quiet's Album of the Year 2016 and won the 2016 Scottish Album of the Year (SAY) Award.She is published by a new partnership between Warp Publishing and Faber Music Publishing, and is one of the first Somerset House Studios residents. Much to Anna's surprise she was voted Number One in The List's Hot100 (of Cultural Contributors to 2016).
Genaro Aristizábal is an actor, known for Los colores de la montaña (2010).
Carlos César Arbeláez is a director and writer, known for Los colores de la montaña (2010), What They Called Love and Eso que llaman amor (2015).

One half of a pair of identical twins, Raghu Ram is best known for creating "Roadies", the longest running reality show in India, and "Splitsvilla", India's first and longest running romance reality show.Born in New Delhi, Raghu's first brush with the world of broadcasting was as a spot boy for TV spots on child labor. Raghu dropped out of college along with his twin and they started working in the then-nascent Indian Television industry as trainees at the age of 20.He considers his 1 year stint as content producer at BBC World Service Trust, New Delhi, as his most significant and formative.Raghu moved to Mumbai in 2003 to work as a Senior Producer in MTV India, which was then primarily known for music and short format content. That changed with "Roadies", an adventure-reality show that became MTV's signature show. He became part of the audition panel as he was more comfortable in Hindi than others at MTV, and caught the fancy of MTV's young audience with his ability to stress contestants out and his colorful language.Raghu continued to straddle the worlds in front of and behind the camera, while acting in films and writing the autobiographical "Rearview: My Roadies Journey", published in 2013.In 2014, Raghu, along with his monozygotic twin Rajiv, started "Monozygotic Solutions Pvt. Ltd", creating original fiction and non-fiction programming for TV and digital platforms.Raghu is married to Canadian singer Natalie DiLuccio and they live in Mumbai.
column13:
Natalie Di Luccio  (12 December 2018 - present)
Sugandha Garg  (2 February 2006 - 29 January 2018)

column5: Fernando Amaral is an actor, known for Norberto apenas tarde (2010), Il candidato (2016) and Impuros (2018).
Elena Cristiean is known for her work on Monumental (2016), Dark Hours: Roxana (2017) and Mope (2019).
Rachid Badouri is an actor and writer, known for L'appât (2010), Opération Casablanca (2010) and Y'en aura pas de facile (2010).
Juan Palacio is an editor and actor, known for Mexicali (2010), Little Paradise (2015) and Tlatelolco, Verano de 68 (2013).

Manasi Scott topped her Software Engineering Bachelors Degree to pursue a Post Graduation in Film and Television production while releasing two alternative albums with Kelvin Brown in Australia while still in college.She enjoyed the limelight more, and it was only a matter of time before she pursued her singing dream, entering the fashion industry as a show stopper and first face.She has recently been presented the Femina Power List Award for her contribution to live entertainment with over 2,000 live concerts worldwide, including her own concert in Las Vegas, a world tour of her album Naach Le in 2005, three consecutive IIFAA Rocks in Yorkshire, Bangkok and Macau, Lakme Fashion Week, The Bollywood Fashion Awards in New York, the World Military Games, the IPL Opening Ceremony, etc.She has sung and composed the hit song "Khatti Meethi" in Sanjay Gupta's Acid Factory and has also performed the song in the film. She has sung the Tamil playback hits "Pattu Pattu" and "Eisalaamey Eisalaam" for Yuvan Shankar Raja in the films Thillalangadi and Aadhi Baghavan, respectively, and for Hindi and Telegu films too.December 2017's Maxim magazine's elaborate spread has christened her the 'Mistress of Music,' while Citadel magazine labels her the 'ultimate entertainer.'She released her self-titled album, Manasi - The Ideal Woman, last year, with all songs composed by her, co-written by her and Amitabh Bhattacharya, and produced by Ashish Manchanda and her. Her friends Mika Singh, Palash Sen, Raghav Sachar, and Ishq Bector have joined her in duets on the album. This on the heels of her international dubstep hit "High," with Mr. Doss.She is also an accomplished actress, with films like Jhoota Hi Sahi, Ek Main Aur Ekk Tu and Bhaag Johnny to her credit, as well as theatre. She also has a web series on air currently while shooting for another.She is the only Indian singer to have been featured on the cover of The Week.She is also the brand ambassador for many leading brands and the first choice as a compere for many an event, including the Wisden Cricket Awards, Glamorous on Zoom, EBuzz on AXN, and the Ceat Cricket Awards,She's a medal-winning equestrian and show-jumping champion, a black belt in karate, a Scuba diver, a national-level basketball and hockey player, and loves to travel and read.
Camilla Bianchini is an actress and casting director, known for L'appuntamento (2014), La banda Grossi (2018) and Come trovare nel modo giusto l'uomo sbagliato (2011).
Ni Liao is a cinematographer and actor, known for Hou hui wu qi (2014), Huo guo ying xiong (2016) and Feng kuang de wai xing ren (2019).
Hernán Mauricio Ocampo is an actor, known for Pablo Escobar: El Patrón del Mal (2012) and Los colores de la montaña (2010).
Thomas Høite Meersohn is an actor, known for Alting Bliver Godt Igen (2010).
Jessica Dunn Rovinelli is known for her work on So Pretty (2019), Marriage Story (2020) and Empathy (2016).
Vikram Bhat is a producer and director, known for Horror Story (2013) and Kwik Meal (2004).
Kerli Kyllönen is an actress, known for Deadwind (2018), Kotirauha (2011) and Kaappari (2013).
Duncan MacNeil is known for his work on L'illusionista (2010), Machair (1993) and Speaking Our Language (1993).
Srinivasan Shivakar is an actor and assistant director, known for Fingertip (2019), Panjaa (2011) and Sarvam (2009).
Salam Yousefzai is known for his work on The Black Tulip (2010) and Zwischen Welten (2014).

Kirara Asuka was born on October 2, 1988 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Urutoraman Ginga: Gekijou supesharu (2013), Urutoraman Ginga Gekijô Supesharu Urutora Kaijû Hîrô Batoru Roiyaru (2014) and Ultraman Ginga (2013).
Mehdi Saki is an actor and composer, known for Ertefae Past (2002), Ruz-e-sevom (2007) and Darbare 111 dokhtar (2012).
Tuomas Niskanen is known for his work on Samurai Rauni Reposaarelainen (2016) and Mies ja videokamera (2009).
Benedicte Aubert Ringnes is a producer, known for Hjelp, vi er i filmbransjen (2011).
Rhys Ward was born on September 6, 1989 in Ancaster, Ontario, Canada. He is an actor, known for The 100 (2014), The Returned (2015) and State of Syn (2013).
Emma MacKenzie is an actress and writer, known for Night of the Naked Dead (2012), Lazarus Rising (2015) and The Rude, the Mad, and the Funny (2014).
Michael Hough is an actor, known for Boys from County Hell (2020), A Perfect Plan (2020) and My Name Is Emily (2015).
Dustin Supencheck is known for his work on Un nuovo futuro (2017), The Sand (2015) and Get the Girl (2017).
Cheryl Ching-Sy is known for her work on Dahil sa pag-ibig (2019), Bihag (2019) and Dragon Lady (2019).
Roser Tapias was born on August 20, 1989. She is an actress, known for I'm Being Me (2020), Èxode (2019) and Animals (2012).
Miranda Admire is an actress, known for American Maniacs (2012).
Aminca Bond is an actress, known for American Maniacs (2012).

Taylor Frey is an American Actor best known for his work as 'Don Hagarty' in the Warner Brothers feature It Chapter Two. He also starred in Summertime, directed by Gabriele Muccino's (The Pursuit of Happyness, Seven Pounds), which debuted at the Venice Film Festival, and as 'Topher' in teen comedy film G.B.F. directed by Darren Stein. Taylor has a successful Broadway career starring in multiple shows on Broadway including Hairspray, How to Succeed and South Pacific, and starring as Patrick in "The View Upstairs".
Louis Bernstein is an actor, known for Dough Boys (2009).

Meek Mill was born on May 6, 1987 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA as Robert Rihmeek Williams. He is an actor and composer, known for Bright (2017), Spring Breakers - Una vacanza da sballo (2012) and Creed - Nato per combattere (2015).
K.B. Venu is an actor, known for Pakal Nakshatrangal (2008) and Last Bench (2012).
Rollyn Stafford is an actor and director, known for A Letter to Bob (2016), Road to Bob (2019) and 1 Dead Dog.
Nafessa Williams was born on December 4, 1989 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA. She is an actress, known for Black Lightning (2017), La legge dei più forti (2019) and Twin Peaks: il ritorno (2017).

Actor Murugan Chillayah showed his natural talent for Acting and Singing since young age, with participation of several arts competition and showed his talent in singing competition at State level. He experienced working as Singapore Police Officer from 1999 to 2001. In 2001, he also further studied for International Marketing Management in Ibmec Campus, Somerset, Singapore.His father Chillayah, mother Saradamah, younger brother Gopalan and younger sister Kogilaveny gave a lot of morale support in his career achievement.His talent in Singapore begin from blend of contemporary, folk and modern dance with Rameshwara dance group. He usually performing outdoor dance shooting for prime time television show in Singapore MediaCorp Vasantham channel. Popular dance performed was Podhumdaa Podhumdaa (tamil song from movie Arputham) at location Chinese Garden, Singapore (2002) with Rameshwara dance group.After his debut in Metti Oli Singapore Show 2004 held in Singapore Indoor Stadium, located in Kallang Singapore.Producer Murugesu of Singapore MediaCorp Vasantham offered him Tamil Serial Drama opportunity. His first Tamil drama was award winning and popular drama Suttu Viral (Pointing Finger) by EagleVision Singapore 2005, police crime prevention real-story in Tamil version as Crime Scene Investigator named "Muru", along with Singapore Actress Noorul Hassan Shareef, Kalaiselvi Grace and other several artist.He then appeared in first romantic comedy tamil drama directed by Singapore MediaCorp Vasantham's Producer Murugesu "Miss Janu" who portrayed supporting role as "Suresh" the popular university student, along with Best Model of the World 1998 Annetha Ayyavoo from Singapore acted as "Miss Janu" the ugly swan which turned beautiful princess.His last Singapore Television Drama was 24/7, another romantic comedy drama as secondary school teacher (short sequel-role).
Alexander Merrill is known for his work on Are You Mr Lonelee? (2014), showing... (2014) and She Feast.

Alex Frnka was born on November 16, 1988 in Houston, Texas, USA as Alexandra Nicole Frnka. She is an actress and director, known for The Inbetweeners: Quasi maturi (2012), LA to Vegas (2018) and The Detained (2017).
Steven Lee Edwards is an actor, known for Dry Spell (2013), Weary Sun (2010) and Maggie Marvel (2011).
Johnny Rasse is an actor, known for Ma vie avec James Dean (2017), Les fraises des bois (2011) and 14 Septembre (2012).

Adam Richard Steigert is a Buffalo born filmmaker, husband and business partner to Producer and Casting Director, Kristin Steigert. Adam attended Hamburg High School and made the decision early on in his career to work behind the camera, quickly earning himself the title as film Producer/ Writer/Editor and Director. He is known for his films Ombis: Alien Invasion, A Grim Becoming, Fang, and the anticipated "The Horrific Evil Monsters" which wrapped principal photography in July! He co-founded the Buffalo-based production company DefTone Pictures Studios [Defunct], the Buffalo Film Extras Facebook page and is a co-founder for 388 Studios. Often classified as a "magician" for the horror and special effect featured in his films. Adam creates epic landscapes through thrifty creative decisions and storytelling. He has been featured in books, newspapers, magazines, podcasts, and various interviews. Adam has spoken on a variety of filmmaking panels throughout his career speaking about Directing, distribution and the Art of Filmmaking.

Jack Cullison was born in San Bernardino, Ca. but grew up in Everett, Washington till the age of 14. Jack and his mother picked up and moved to Orange County,Ca. for a better living. After High School, Jack was an adventure seeker traveling to different parts of the world, working odd jobs to fund his excursions, before deciding to venture out to Los Angeles to explore the arts. When he arrived in Los Angeles he immediately starting working in film. Jack booked his first audition and secured a starring role in a Feature put together by Producer David Michael Latt of The Asylum Productions & Director Scott Wheeler, and gained notoriety as "Brandon Murphy" in the cult classic teen comedy "Milf", which is a film often compared to the popular "American Pie". A year and half later he teamed up with Latt & Wheeler again and starred in the teen comedy "Celebrity Sex Tape" as "Ross Gans". Jack's screen credits also include several short films, and web-series. Jack has starring roles in 2 Features set to release at the end of 2014, including a Futuristic Scifi Thriller starring himself and Yancy Butler (Witchblade),(Kick-Ass 1,2),(Drop Zone) & 2 other Features set to shoot early 2015.
Peter Hutchings is a director and writer, known for Alla fine ci sei tu (2018), Le reiette (2017) and The Last Keepers - Le ultime streghe (2013).
Piero Guerrera is a writer and actor, known for Aspirante vedovo (2013), Qualunquemente (2011) and Tutto tutto niente niente (2012).
John Doughty is an actor, known for Weaverfish (2013), Kilo Due Bravo - Ad un passo dalla morte (2014) and CyberBeat (2010).

Kirsty Bell is a successful film Producer, seasoned Executive Producer, Debut Director and Chartered Tax Advisor who has spent much of her early career at the top of global accountancy firms before founding Goldfinch. This combined expertise has seen her focus on the structuring of entertainment companies and their finance raises since 1996. Since she founded Goldfinch in 2014 she has raised over $350m for the industry and achieved in excess of 70 Producer / Executive Producer credits to her name. for a stable of 200 + projects across the Film, TV, Animation and Video Games sectors. Goldfinch is a vertically integrated Studio with finance, production and distribution capabilities, launching birdbox.film earlier this year. In 2020, she made her directorial debut with ALONE.
Bidzina Gujabidze is an actor, known for The Loneliest Planet (2011) and Tskhra mtas iqit (2015).

Laura Bilgeri is a young actress & singer based in Los Angeles, New York & Vienna. In less than four years in Hollywood, she has worked in feature film, network and cable television and done voice overs and commercials. She recently played the female lead in the sci-fi/action thriller "The Recall" alongside Wesley Snipes ("Blade") and RJ Mitte ("Breaking Bad"). She also has a recurring role on the major CW/Warner Bros. Network Show "iZombie" where she plays Sloane Mills. Born in Vienna, Austria, she partly grew up in Northern Italy and spent a lot of time in Paris. Because of her international background, Laura speaks English, German, French and Italian without an accent. She began her acting career when she was 14 years old and made her feature film debut in the film "A Breath Of Heaven", which won the Golden Rooster Award for best foreign film. She then appeared in the popular German/Austrian TV Series Vienna Crime Squad. Laura gained international attention when she got a role in the 2014 World War I Drama "The Silent Mountain" along side film icon Claudia Cardinale ("Once Upon a Time in the West") and British actor William Moseley ("The Chronicles Of Narnia", "Royals"). In 2015, Bilgeri was featured in a US wide Mazda Commercial, produced by Ridley Scott & directed by Jake Scott. Shortly after she co-starred alongside Emmy Award winning actress Pamela Adlon in the critically acclaimed FX series "Better Things". In early 2017 Laura booked another leading role in the Netflix Drama "My Teacher, My Obsession". She's also been working as a singer for the past two years - mainly focusing on Jazz. In her spare time, she works as a model in the US, Italy, Austria, Germany, Switzerland & China.
Jason Barker is an actor, known for Space Pirate Captain Harlock (2010), Space Pirate Captain Harlock 2 (2010) and Fist of the North Star: The Ray Saga (2011).
Jason David Brown is a production designer and actor, known for Monster Brawl (2011), Septic Man (2013) and Antisocial (2013).
James Boyland is an actor, known for DCI Banks (2010), The Five (2016) and Misfits (2009).

Ines Laimins is an actress based in Hong Kong, fluent in Mandarin, she works locally and internationally in film, commercial, and TV.She frequently works in China filming several TV drama and film roles, working with actor Li Yifeng on Hunan TV series "Wait for You in Beijing" and Wang Chaunjun in "Youth Forever". She is also co-producer of a short documentary "The Beauty Machine" that takes a look at women working in the media industry, powerful messages for women by women.
Paul Finelli is a writer and producer, known for Harodim (2012), Ride and Der Atem des Himmels (2010).

Actor/Singer/Writer Sean Ryan Fox can be seen playing the lead role of Jasper Dunlop in Nickelodeon's longest running hit series Henry Danger (2014). On the show, Sean's character, Jasper Dunlap, can be described as Henry's goofy best friend, whom Henry can always count on to have his back.Besides Henry Danger, Sean can be seen in the indie feature Oggi è sempre Natale (2016), which was released December 2016 and is being distributed by LionsGate Films. In the film, Sean plays the lead role of Eddie, a mischievous, swag-obsessed boy, who must overcome his inner Scrooge or remain caught in a cycle where every day is a Christmas without presents. The film also stars Joey Lawrence, Christy Carlson Romano, and Amber Frank.Sean's other credits include NCIS - Unità anticrimine (2003), Criminal Minds (2005), and Kickin' It - A colpi di karate (2011). He has also starred in the feature films David's Dinosaur (2017); Field of Lost Shoes (2015); and Sex, Death and Bowling (2015). He also was the voice of the animated Disney's Jake on Jake e i pirati dell'Isola che non c'è (2011) and Nickelodeon's pilot The Loud House as Lincoln Loud. Aside from acting, Sean has completed his first album and released his first single and music video, "Indestructible," with great reviews, along with his second song "Perfect Crime" with over 4.5 million views on YouTube.Sean has been performing since he was two years old, putting on shows with his sister's karaoke machine. When he was six years old, he would put on his own made-up plays for his family to watch in the living room and at eight and half years old he got his first agent. He booked his first commercial job for AARP/The Hartford on his ninth birthday, and, after that job, he knew he loved acting and that he wanted to have a career in actingSean was born in Riverside, California, and raised in Newport Beach, California, where he still currently resides. His hobbies include designing various characters for his own universe that he hopes to play later. Sean is a huge Marvel fan and all of its characters, with DeadPool being his favorite. Sean has a big heart who loves to help out in any animal or children-related charities that may come his way.
Nikolaj Nørlund is known for his work on Hvid nat (2007) and Det meste af tiden (2009).

Sasi Kalinga was born in 1961 in India. He was an actor, known for Oru Kadath Naadan Katha (2019), Oppam (2016) and Loham (2015). He was married to Prabhavathi. He died on April 7, 2020 in Kozhikode, Kerala, India.
column9: April 7, 2020 in Kozhikode, Kerala, India  (liver disease)

column5: Heather McIntosh started her musical career playing with the bands of The Elephant 6 Collective, Gnarls Barkley, and Lil Wayne. Following her touring days, she has been regularly composing music for film and television since 2011. In addition to being a frequent collaborator on Duplass brothers productions, Heather was one of four women eligible for the Academy Awards Best Original Score in 2013 for Craig Zobel's Compliance, and again in 2015 with Craig's film, Z for Zachariah, both of which premiered at The Sundance Film Festival. Heather is an alumna of The Sundance Institute Music & Sound Design Labs at Skywalker Sound, a 2014 Sundance Institute Time Warner Foundation Fellow, and a member of the Academy class of 2016. Her credits include Faults directed by Riley Stearns, the series One Dollar for CBS All Access, Astra Taylor's feature documentary What is Democracy?, and Riley Stearns' upcoming The Art of Self-Defense. Heather's most recent project, To The Stars directed by Martha Stephens, premiered at Sundance in 2019 as part of the US Dramatic Competition.
Simon Cornwell is a producer, known for Hotel Artemis (2018), La spia - A Most Wanted Man (2014) and The Night Manager (2016).
Marie-Ange Casta was born on July 5, 1990 in France. She is an actress, known for Mineurs 27 (2011), Il mio profilo migliore (2019) and Vento contrario (2011).
Michael Thompson is an actor, known for Expiration (2011) and The Unforgiving (2010).
Tatiana Tarskaya is an actress, known for Beyond the Steppes (2010).

Mark Anthony is an American filmmaker born October 16th in New York. Mark starred in his first stage play at the age of 7, a Kindergarten production of "Romeo and Juliet", at the Milestone School in Mount Vernon, NY. A picture from the performance even made it into the local newspaper in Mount Vernon, thus further sparking his interest in acting.As a teenager Mark decided to take a hiatus from acting to play sports at his various schools. After high school, he attended college at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY) and received a Theater Scholarship. He graduated with a Bachelors in Theater/Communications. While attending college Mark starred in four Theater Productions including a portrayal of African American Theater pioneer James Hewlett in "The African Company Presents: King Richard the Third", "Antigone" and "No Exit". In 2008 Mark performed in his first Off-Broadway production entitled "Finding Home" at the New Perspectives Theater in Manhattan.Mark currently resides in Los Angeles, California where he hones his craft taking on various Film and Theater roles.
Michelle Cameron is a producer and production manager, known for Digital Physics (2015), We've Forgotten More Than We Ever Knew (2016) and Good Ol' Boy (2015).
Claire Opperman is an actress, known for The Unforgiving (2010).
Luca Del Puppo is known for his work on Glass (2019), Slender Man (2018) and Green Book (2018).
Andrew Harwood is known for his work on The Room (2003), Elimination (2010) and The Burden of My Company (2015).

Born in Liverpool, Dan spent much of his youth exposed to the film scores of Goldsmith, Horner, Williams, Zimmer and more. By the age of 18, he was working as a corporate Videographer and Video Editor, with a long term aim to work as a writer/director of film. It was during this time he discovered the limitations of music libraries for editors, and began making his own music to accompany his video projects. Deciding to pursue his long-term interest in film music, he then invested in a modest home studio and within weeks of this was scoring low-budget features for international filmmakers. Dan has no formal musical education, but has utilised his knowledge of both the editing/composing process, self-taught composition skills and natural musicality to delivery digitally produced music quickly and affordably to filmmakers. He now composes alongside maintaining a full-time IT career between London and his home in Hampshire. He still writes, and hopes to publish fiction novels in the time allowed between projects.
Eric Hulsebos is an actor, known for The Wise Kids (2011).
Frank Stennett is an actor, known for The Wise Kids (2011).
Oselito Joseph is an actor and producer, known for Gilgamesh (2014), Killing Khan (2016) and Polypore (2013).
Bernard Rouquette is an actor, known for Au fond des bois (2010).

Briana Cuoco was born on November 29, 1988 in Ventura, California, USA as Briana Justine Cuoco. She is an actress, known for The Lydia Bennet!! (2012), The Lizzie Bennet Diaries (2012) and NCIS - Unità anticrimine (2003).
Jae Phan is known for his work on Battle B-Boy (2016), Turbo (2009) and A Better Place (2011).

Ariana Berlin was born on October 29, 1987 in San Diego, California, USA. She is known for her work on Full Out (2015), Walk-Off Stories: Improbably Gibson (2018) and Truth Be Told: Rick Ankiel (2019).
column6: October 29, 1987 in San Diego, California, USA

column5: Christine Saade is an actress and assistant director, known for Chambers Gate (2014), The Action Director (2012) and Katie Chats (2011).
Christel Pedrinelli is an actress, known for Niente da dichiarare? (2010), You are the Canvas (2015) and Happy Birthday Mr. Zombie (2012).
Hayrullah Evrenos is an actor, known for Askin ikinci yarisi (2010) and Die Fremde (2010).
Charles Rogers was born on July 5, 1987 in Dallas, Texas, USA. He is a writer and producer, known for Search Party (2016), Fort Tilden (2014) and Men Don't Whisper (2017).

Stephen Dest was born in New Haven, Connecticut, USA. He is known for his work on My Brother Jack (2013), I Am Shakespeare (2017) and Blind (2008).Stephen is a professor of film studies at the University of Connecticut and a frequent juror and guest at various film festivals.Father of two beautiful children.
Ziya Çelik is an actor, known for En Büyük Saban (1983).
Aneta Wróbel-Wojtyszko is a writer and assistant director, known for Doreczyciel (2009), Drogi wolnosci (2018) and Swiety interes (2010).
Petra Spencer Pearce is a producer and editor, known for Return to the Hiding Place (2013), War of Resistance (2011) and Is Atlantis in the Bible? (2002).

Prashant Pillai is a prolific up and coming music producer based out of India. A qualified sound engineer he started off his career with the now 2 time Oscar Winning music composer A.R. Rahman.In early 2007, Prashant made his mark as a music producer with the short film Rahu where the film and his work got noticed for the influences in Sufi music and an earthy, ethnic and atmospheric sound-scape used in the score.He has worked on a few critically acclaimed films like Nayakan (2010) and City of God (2011), and the much awaited Shaitan (2011) produced by Anurag Kashyap and directed by Bejoy Nambiar. Drifting away from the clichéd sounds, Prashant's distinct sounds and unusual song styles make his compositions unique.Known for his uncanny fusion of genres and instruments, he is known to be fun to work with and a artists composer.
Brady Noon was born in Forked River, New Jersey, USA. He is an actor, known for Good Boys - Quei cattivi ragazzi (2019), Boardwalk Empire: L'impero del crimine (2010) and The Mighty Ducks.

Laurence Love Greed is a British composer, experimental musician and motion picture music editor, who's multidisciplinary work spans film, television, pop music, installation art, and live performance.Laurence's recent composer credits include the score for BBC One thriller Keeping Faith, starring Eve Myles, which Laurence won the 2018 BAFTA Cymru for Original Music, with songwriter Amy Wadge. Other composer credits include the BBC's NHS commemorative film To Provide All People, starring Michael Sheen and Martin Freeman, and indie feature A Serial Killer's Guide To Life.A pianist and percussionist, sound recordist and editor, he has worked closely with many other composers, including Howard Shore, Max Richter, David Arnold and Rupert Gregson-Williams, helping to craft the soundtracks for award winning films and television programmes such as The Hobbit (Warner Bros), Taboo (BBC/Scott Free), Sherlock (BBC) and The Crown (Netflix).In 2016, Love Greed wrote the score to the multi BAFTA winning Aberfan: The Green Hollow (Michael Sheen, Jonathan Pryce). He directed parts of the film where the present day primary school children sing hymns before class. The audio recordings from these scenes later formed part of the score. He also recorded a band in Abbey Road Studio 2 using 1960's recording equipment to achieve an authentic recording quality.His installation work as a member of Wintour's Leap has been exhibited in London and Glasgow, and explores the relationship between technology and music using immersive and reactive spaces for improvised performance.He works closely and frequently with leading sound artist Nick Ryan as orchestrator and co-project leader. In 2016 they travelled to 30 locations on the Yangtze River in China, gathering field recordings for a large public sound installation at Gatwick Airport. This project 'A Living River' transports visitors to the Yangtze River using 120 speakers in a spatial array along the Skybridge. It is experienced by over a million people a year.Laurence has twice been a tutor at the Aldeburgh Young Musician courses.Laurence has worked as string arranger and percussionist for Imogen Heap. He programmed, recorded, edited and mixed pieces for her Love The Earth project, which later became key components to the soundtrack of the play Harry Potter and the Cursed Child.He also performed piano on Ed Sheeran's album Divide, and as percussionist he has performed with Imogen Heap and the London Contemporary Voices.

Guy Holmes published the literary thriller P.E.A.C.E. about the coming surveillance state with Simon & Schuster. He wrote the screenplay for Mindscape, which was released in 2014 in the United States as Anna. Anna starred Mark Strong and Taissa Farmiga. He collaborates on all film and TV projects with his writing partner, Anne Robinson.

Charlie Plummer stars in the A24 release Lean On Pete, written and directed by Andrew Haigh (45 Years) and featuring Steve Buscemi, Chloë Sevigny and Travis Fimmel. At the end of 2017, he appeared in Ridley Scott's kidnap thriller All the Money in the World, playing John Paul Getty III alongside Christopher Plummer, Michelle Williams and Mark Wahlberg, shooting in Rome, Jordan and London.Forthcoming features include Spontaneous opposite Katherine Langford, Words on Bathroom Walls alongside Taylor Russell, Andy Garcia, Walton Goggins and Molly Parker, Clovehitch with Dylan McDermott, Gully with Amber Heard, Kelvin J. Harrison and Jacob Latimore, and Share, written and directed by Pippa Bianco.Charlie played the titular role in King Jack, which won the Audience Award at the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival, released theatrically in 2016. He was most recently seen in the 2017 indie drama thriller, The Dinner, opposite Richard Gere, Laura Linney, Steve Coogan, Chloë Sevigny and Rebecca Hall, written and directed by Oren Moverman. Charlie began his professional career in Sopranos' creator David Chase's feature film, Not Fade Away, and the same year was cast in a recurring role in HBO's award-winning Boardwalk Empire. He was also a series regular on the Netflix cold war drama Granite Flats, starring with Christopher Lloyd and Parker Posey.Charlie splits time between New York City and upstate, with his mother, actress Maia Guest, father, writer and producer John Christian Plummer, younger brother James, and Luigi, their English bulldog.
The Lotus is an actor and composer, known for Ban jin ba liang (1976) and Tian cai yu bai chi (1975).
Hajime Ohata is a director and writer, known for ABCs of Death 2 (2014), Daikenjû (2009) and Fool Japan: The ABCs of Tetsudon (2014).
Jessica Caldwell is a producer, known for Electrick Children (2012), AWOL (2016) and Delicacy (2012).
Fero Walandouw is an actor, known for Ananta (2018), Nakalnya Anak Muda (2010) and Zodiac: Apa Bintangmu? (2017).
Muharrem Dokur is known for his work on Tatli Küçük Yalancilar (2015), Dört Köse (2017) and Ümmü Sibyan: Zifir (2014).
Tanya Jaziri is an actress, known for Kollama (2008), Arka Sokaklar (2006) and O kul: Hayal bile etme (2010).
Kayra Simur is an actress, known for 3 harfliler: Marid (2010) and Gümüs (2005).
Victor Froiman was born on February 3, 1997 in Sao Paulo, Brazil. He is an assistant director and actor, known for Daqui Pra Frente (2019), Growing Pains (2019) and Colônia (2020).

Breno Viola is a brazilian judo athlete. He was the first person with Down syndrome in all Americas to get a black belt in this sport. He travels around Brazil to do speeches and participate in debates about Down syndrome, and already gave many interviews to TV and press in general because of his role as athlete. 'Colegas (Buddies)' is his first experience in acting.
Teymur Odushev is an actor, known for Sahä (2010).
Pavel Akimkin is an actor and composer, known for Ya uchitel (2016), Moskva, ya lyublyu tebya! (2010) and Doktor (2012).
Zuzu Bejashvili is an actor, known for Gogona Slaididan (2009), Sahä (2010) and Bridge (2020).
Max Hubacher was born in 1993 in Bern, Kanton Bern, Switzerland. He is an actor, known for Der Hauptmann (2017), Mario (2018) and Der Läufer (2018).
Hiroki Hasegawa was born on March 7, 1977 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Shin Godzilla (2016), Shingeki no kyojin (2015) and Sekando bâjin (2011).

Nellie was born in Saint-Petersburg, Russia to Korean father and Jewish mother with Eastern European background. Through childhood she was trained in piano, singing and ballet. At the age of 11 she spent a year in Chicago studying English, right after she moved back to her hometown, she was cast as a lead in the TV-Series for adolescents "OBZH" and worked there for 4 seasons. After graduating school Nellie pursued her acting career in Moscow, while studying in a Theatrical Institute she appeared in several TV productions and expressed her feelings to the capital in the Film "Moscow, I love you!". In 2009, she moved to Paris to study theatre at "L'école Claude Mathieu", where she has learned French, playing Moliere, Racine and Claudel. Nellie toured with a play on Moliere's life "Babel Molière", received a best actress award for a French film "The Salt of Earth" and started to dance Argentine Tango. Nellie resides in Los Angeles.
Jessica London-Shields is an actress and producer, known for Jamie and Jessie Are Not Together (2011) and Chrysalis (2014).
Adem Ugur is a director and actor, known for Zohak (2018), Cinni alem kapisi and Çok Mu Komik? (2011).

Beth Kander was named Best Jackson Writer by the Jackson Free Press in 2011 and 2009. Recent honors include Best Writer, "The Retirement Party," 48 Hour Film Project (City: Jackson; "The Retirement Party" also won Best Film and is continuing on to nationals) and the 2012 Charles M. Getchell New Play Award (SETC) for her new play "Scrambled."Recent publications include the children's book "Glubbery Gray" (Pelican Publishing, 2010) and two full length plays ("Scrambled" and "See Jane Quit," 2012, both available from Steele Spring Theatrical Licensing), among others and with more on the way.As an actress, Beth has appeared in several short films including "Sense" (Eyevox Entertainment), "Shock" (Chris Spear), and the book trailer for "Night of the Living Trekkies" (Justin Lutsky / Quirk Books).Possibly most interesting, Beth has an adorable rescue dog named Dov who was in a viral video, which landed him on Web Soup, Attack of the Show, and even in Jay Leno's monologue on Late Night. Seriously. Her working life goal, along with making the world a better place, is to be more famous than her dog.
Ufuk Asar is an actor, known for Arka Sokaklar (2006), Yunus Emre (2015) and Seytan-i racim (2013).
Jiwan Luitel was born on September 10, 1981 in Biratnagar, Nepal. He is an actor, known for Kafal Pakyo (2016), Notebook (2013) and Sano Sansar (2008).
Scherwin Amini is an actor and assistant director, known for Stationspiraten (2010), Reinfall (2009) and Tempo Girl (2013).

Courtney Blythe Turk is an American actress and producer of Greek and Native American descent. She grew up in the small town of Monroeville, Alabama and later attended Auburn University with a major in Mass Communications, concentration in Sports Broadcasting, and a Theater minor. Courtney's career in entertainment was sparked when she landed the role as co-host of the sports travel show Fantactics in 2011. Since then, she has appeared in numerous roles on both film and television, such as VH1's Hit the Floor and a leading role in the feature film Black Water.Courtney earned her first producing role with the feature film The Ticket (Tribeca Film Festival 2016) starring Malin Akerman, Dan Stevens and Oliver Platt. Both her passion and her experience working behind the camera on the film led her to later produce the thriller Assassination Nation (Sundance Film Festival 2018) starring Bella Thorne, Suki Waterhouse, and Bill Skarsgard, Netflix's To the Bone (Sundance Film Festival 2017) starring Keanu Reeves and Lily Collins, and the award winning documentary The Last Animals (Tribeca Film Festival 2017). She is in development on many other productions, including a police drama inspired by true events with Hidden Empire (Black and Blue, Traffik) and a hallucinatory thriller with Terry Rossio (Pirates of the Caribbean) and Bill Marsilii (Deja Vu).

Born and raised in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Mark Gibson is a Canadian actor living and working in Toronto. A graduate of the Acting Conservatory at York University in Toronto, Gibson began his career and is most recognized for his work in the indie film Exit Humanity (2011). Along with pursuing his passion for indie film, Gibson continues to work in both Canadian and American television.
Tapan Bhattacharya is known for his work on 720 Degrees (2010) and Galpa Holeo Satyi (1966).
Sayaka Hanamura is an actress, known for Le voci della nostra infanzia (2007), Nitaboh: Tsugaru shamisen shiso gaibun (2004) and Chieri to Cherî (2015).

Taisiya Vilkova was born on October 25, 1996 in Moscow, Russia as Taisiya Aleksandrovna Vilkova. She is an actress, known for Vyshe neba (2019), Gogol. Nachalo (2017) and Ded Moroz. Bitva Magov (2016). She has been married to Semyon Serzin since March 27, 2020.

RJ Smith is an Emmy Swag Recipient, American Optioned Screenwriter and Contemporary Horror Novelist of nail-biting of Mystery/Suspense/Thrillers with wicked story development. The writer is best known for his unique style of developing a story, blazing a trail of the modern tale by mixing his experience in Hollywood writing SPEC imagery with literary form causing the reader to feel as if they are a fly on the wall!Noted by Francis Ford Coppola American Zoetrope Studios, The Page International Screenwriting Awards, The Emmy Swags and Sundance Table Read My Screenplay, RJ is represented by NYC literary agent Joyce Keating, London's Robert Snow and Hollywood Manager Julie Stern.RJ is the creator of The Santa Claus Killer-Book #1, FBI Serial Killer Task Force. Cataclysm, Monsters in the Woods, Beach Bodies, Man's Best Friend, Destiny, Man's Best Friend, Walk of Fame Killer, and of course Dead Man Walking.

Lyndsey Craine graduated from York St. John University with a degree in Film and Television Production in 2010. Lyndsey's feature film roles have gravitated towards the horror genre including parts in The Creature Below (Dark Rift Films) and Zomblogalypse (Milestone Films). Book of Monsters was Lyndsey's first leading role in a feature film and her performance earned her multiple nominations for Best Actress at genre festivals around the world during the film's festival run.Prior to her feature film work. Lyndsey starred in several award winning short films including 'Rats!', 'Translucent Lenses' and 'The Sword' which won a Royal Television Society award for Best Short.
Eisuke Naitô is a director and writer, known for Sensei wo ryûzan saseru-kai (2011), Pazuru (2014) and Raichi Hikari kurabu (2015).

Two time Emmy Award winning producer, Christa Morris started out working in local media for NBC, CBS, FOX, Univision, HTVN, and Azteca in Nashville, Miami, Dallas, Philadelphia, New York, and Los Angeles.In February of 2010, realizing that traditional media needed to expand its vision, Christa approached Open Book Productions and Crystal Chappell to get a better understanding of the cutting edge new media being created and distributed on the web. This meeting lead to an opportunity for Christa to become Co-Ex Producer of Venice the Series, The Grove, and Beacon Hill. Her work resulted in two Daytime Emmys for the groundbreaking "Venice the Series", and a nomination for a third for Beacon Hill. In 2015 she got her first feature film producer credit for "A Million Happy Nows", and now works as a Development producer of scripted and unscripted original programming for Television, Documentaries, and Film.A country kid through and through, Christa was raised in small-town America, moving every couple of years. She considers Dallas, Texas her hometown. Following in the footsteps of her grandfather, she's always felt very lucky in her life and career to have been befriended and mentored by the most amazing men and women who took the time to teach a country kid all that life has to offer and empowering her love for music, technology, and the entertainment industry.

Maxwell Sterling is a composer for film, television, dance and multi-media. Originally from Manchester, he graduated from Leeds College of Music and moved to Los Angeles to study at UCLA. During his 5 years time in LA, Maxwell has worked on numerous projects and noticeably scored films such as 'A Girl Like Grace', 'Investigation 13' and 'Chicanery'. His musical style ranges from improvised jazz to classical, left-field electronic to minimal, always taking lead from the narrative.Maxwell has now returned to the UK and lives in London, working on the follow up of his record 'Hollywood Medieval' and giving performances based on improvisation at Cafe Oto, The Design Museum & more.More recently Maxwell has scored Greg Wohead's theatre work 'Call It A Day' short documentary 'Cablestreet' which premiered at this year Sundance Festival and has been doing sessions with a wide range of exciting artists.

A native of Montreal, Quebec, Justin Finney is a Producer and Production Manager with FH Studio located in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Justin is in charge of the day to day operations which include development, pre-production, production, post-production, worldwide distribution and sales. As a former Hollywood Independent Studio Senior Executive Vice-President, multi-award winning film Producer and Executive Producer, Justin has had the privilege to have worked with some of the biggest names and actors in the entertainment industry. Justin was also the Senior Executive Vice-President and Chief Operations Officer at California Pictures Inc headquartered at Paramount Studios in Hollywood, California.
Bill Dubuque is a writer and producer, known for The Accountant (2016), Ozark (2017) and Quando un padre (2016).
Halil Ibrahim is an actor, known for Gemide (1998), Arka Sokaklar (2006) and Meleklerin mucizesi (2014).

Jack Finigan Davis was born in Pittsburgh, PA in 1985 to Charles and Shawn Davis. He studied Communications Media at Indiana University of Pennsylvania, graduating with a Bachelors of Science Degree in 2009. It was at IUP Jack enrolled in his first acting class and in 2011 he enrolled at Playhouse West in Los Angeles, California.
Jason Dallas is an editor and producer, known for Last Rights the Series (2013), A Belle for Christmas (2014) and Cupid's Proxy (2017).

Kseniya Baskakova was born on March 27, 1988 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR as Kseniya Valerevna Baskakova. She is an actress and director, known for Ptitsa (2017), Papa, proshchay (2015) and Krolchikha (2015).
column6: March 27, 1988 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR [now Russia]

column5: Peter Kenneth Jones is known for his work on Battleship (2012), Tartarughe Ninja (2014) and Snowpiercer (2013).
Rita Pokk is an actress, known for Colegas (2012) and Three Lives and One Dream (2021).
Dan Liebman is an actor, known for Among Them (2018), Source (2011) and 10 (2012).
Tatiana De Rosnay was born on September 28, 1961 in Paris, France. She is a writer and actress, known for La chiave di Sara (2010), Boomerang (2015) and Eiffel (2021).
Ryan Ford is an actor and producer, known for Stolen Thoughts: The Missing Memory (2010) and Wake the Dead (2017).
Shari Marie Montiague is a production designer and actress, known for Barcelona: A Love Untold (2016), You're My Boss (2015) and It Takes a Man and a Woman (2013).

Tarabily is an editor based in Cairo, Egypt. He has 6 years of work experience in video & cinema editing. Tarabily holds a Bachelors degree from High Cinema Institute in Cairo, Egypt. Tarabily is a very passionate editor; he wants to utilize his skills and potentials to make a difference in people's lives.
Suivai Autagavaia is an actress, known for Hibiscus & Ruthless (2018), I misteri di Brokenwood (2014) and Brown Boys (2019).

Musician and composer who writes for films, documentaries, animations, commercials, and other media platforms. With roots in a wide variety of musical styles, from full orchestral, jazz and everything in-between, his ability to tailor music for specific projects is what he is known for. His music has been played on Amazon Prime, NBC, ABC, CBS, Fox, PBS, Malco Cinemas, Comcast, as well as regional and International film projects.
Saman Anthony is an actor, known for Il capitale umano (2013), Perez. (2014) and Una domenica notte (2013).

Denny Schneidemesser is an award-winning film and video game composer, most known for scoring animated short films. The German-born composer picked up music composition in 2007 and quickly took on film scoring as his profession, despite the lack of any prior musical training.Within 2 years, he was already producing commercial music, including the score to feature-length indie film "Somebody's Hero." At the same time, he began scoring for numerous animated short films, most notably for "Tiny Nomad" which was nominated for the Annie Awards in 2015.Denny had started moving to Los Angeles in 2018, intending to keep his focus on animated films, while also getting into video game music.

Diane Guerrero (born July 21, 1986) is an American actress. She is best known for her roles as Maritza Ramos on the Netflix series Orange Is the New Black and Lina on Jane the Virgin. Among her other roles was a recurring role on Are We There Yet? Guerrero grew up in Boston and remained there after the rest of her family was deported to Colombia. She is an advocate for immigration reform. Her role on Orange Is the New Black has twice contributed to wins for the Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series.Guerrero was born in New Jersey to Colombian parents and raised in Boston, Massachusetts. As the only member of her immediate family with United States citizenship (by virtue of being born in the country), she remained in the U.S. when her parents and older brother were deported back to Colombia when she was 14. Her parents had pursued legal citizenship, but had been fraudulently represented. Guerrero's niece, who also grew up without a strong family support system, later served time in jail.Guerrero was raised in the Jamaica Plain and Roxbury neighborhoods of Boston after being taken in by other Colombian families. She has had an interest in acting since a young age and took advantage of free opportunities in the neighborhood or at school. Then she attended Boston Arts Academy, a performing arts high school, where she was in the music department. Among her high school activities was singing with a jazz group, but she anticipated pursuing political science and communications in college. In 2010, she appeared in the Faces music video that was shot in Norwood, Massachusetts for Louie Bello. Her first job after college was in a law office. At age 24, she decided to pursue a career in acting. In 2011, she moved to New York City and studied acting at the Susan Batson Studios where she met her manager Josh Taylor. Guerrero's life experience compels her to advocate for immigration reform and is an influence that she draws upon in her acting.She auditioned for a role on Devious Maids, but was cast in Orange is the New Black, where she plays a Bronx-bred character that is likely Puerto Rican. For season 2, she was part of the cast that earned recognition for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series at the 21st Screen Actors Guild Awards. The cast earned recognition for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series again at the 22nd Screen Actors Guild Awards. She has had a recurring role on Are We There Yet?.In 2014, she appeared in Emoticon ;), a comedy about a May-December romance in which her character's father is involved with a doctoral candidate. Her performance in this film as Amanda ("Mandy") Nevins, an adopted teenage child, elicited positive criticism such as a description of a "well-drawn smaller moment" that was "beautifully rendered" according to Frank Scheck of The Hollywood Reporter and a performance that "command sympathy" according to Inkoo Kang of the Los Angeles Times.One of her upcoming roles is as an 1800s Cuban confederate spy, loosely based on the life of Loreta Janeta Velazquez, for Peter and John. She was cast in The CW's series Jane the Virgin in a recurring role. In February 2015, Guerrero was cast as the female lead in CBS' television pilot for Super Clyde, but the show was not picked up for series when CBS announced its fall schedule in May. Guerrero has upcoming film roles in Happy Yummy Chicken, Beyond Control and The Godmother.In 2016, Guerrero released In the Country We Love: My Family Divided a memoir about her parents being detained and deported when she was fourteen. The book's written with Michelle Burford and published by Henry Holt and Co.

The film was a story of Curtis Snow and the harsh realities of living in one of the most dangerous streets in the US, the BLUFF in Atlanta GA. His performance and realism in this film have brought an amazing amount of attention.

A pioneer of Israeli Genre Films, Eitan Gafny is always looking for a bigger boat, and a new challenge to face.Born in 1981, he studied film in high school, and later at Tel Aviv University's film department. A numerous award winning short films (including a 50 minute Romantic Horror Comedy), Eitan moved up to feature films, with Israel's first ever Zombie film, "Cannon Fodder", AKA "Battle of the Undead". After screening the film in over 35 film festivals worldwide, winning 7 awards, and signing a worldwide distribution deal, Eitan decided to take his love for Genre films a step further, and so came "Children of the Fall" - an ambitious throw back to the slasher films of the 1970's, with strong political and social commentary. Eitan is now working on his future projects, while trying to come to terms with the fact that he will never be a fireman, since films are his one and only passion.

As an accomplished Actor, Model, Entrepreneur, and Philanthropist, he is definitely a man of many hats. When Thai enters a room his commanding presence is immediately felt. Combined with charisma, charm and a serious work ethic rivaled by few, he is destined to be, Hollywood's next leading man. Being from the south side of Chicago, he comes from very humble beginnings, which only brings out the very best in him both professionally and personally. Now a California resident, he has allowed the journey life has taken him on to help build him into the focused and career-driven entertainer and businessman that he has become. Given his extensive resume and multiple talents, many doors have opened for him during his career as a result and he is destined to become a household name. However, it's his strong work ethic, his love for his craft, and his commitment to pursuing excellence that sets him in a class all by himself. Not to mention him being a man of great character also. As a firm believer in the outcome of hard work determination, he has managed to maintain great consistency and success in an industry where only the strong survive and is showing no signs of slowing down. In the Fall of 2017, Thai starred in a feature film Anabolic Life, which premiered to rave reviews, calling his performance "Stellar" and his performance immediately created buzz that he was very much a natural born "Standout" star. The film also gained him new fans/supporters around the country with many leaving the theaters wanting to know more about him after seeing his groundbreaking performance in the film. The movie also won an award at the Orlando Film Festival 2017 for "Best Ensemble Cast" and went on to be released internationally. In December of 2017, he was named one of IMDB's "Top 5 Upcoming Actors in 2018". And rightfully so. While 2017 presented him with some great opportunities, 2018 is expected to be an amazing year for him with multiple projects in the works. Outside of his career as an actor/entertainer, he also owns the award-winning Body Couture Personal Fitness Training studio, which is a performance training company with studios in Pasadena, Norwalk, Hollywood and Manhattan Beach, CA. The company is dedicated to helping people in the community reach their personal fitness goals. Thai is also extremely aware and passionate about any and every opportunity that he has to give back to the community. Whether it's speaking to the youth and offering encouragement or volunteering his time to various charity events, he's always looking for ways to bless others who may be in need. He is also in the planning stages of launching his very first non-profit organization in the near future.

Nina Ljeti is an LA-based Canadian filmmaker. A graduate of NYU's prestigious Tisch School of the Arts, she began her career by writing and directing her first feature film, Memoria, which screened at festivals around the world. A classically trained pianist, Nina has a deep understanding of rhythm, timing, and the relationship between moving images and music. This translates into her work as a director and editor for artists such as Rey Pila, Soko, Deap Vally, Collapsing Scenery, and The Growlers. Having been recognized as a rising talent, Nina was listed in MovieMaker Magazine as one of the top 25 Screenwriters to Watch. Her work has been featured on Noisey, IndieWire, Dazed, Miami Art Basel, and at MoMA PS1.Nina is working on her next feature film. (06/17/2017)

Djo Tunda wa Munga was born in 1972 in Kinshasa, DR Congo where he spent his childhood. At the age of 10 he left for Belgium. He studied art school. Later he joined the National Film School of Belgium, INSAS. After completing his studies he returned to Kinshasa where he worked as producer and assistant director for various international TV production (BBC, ARTE, DRTV2).He produced Congo in Four Acts which was successful as both a training and a production project. He was named the African trailblazer 2010 for MIPTV. His debut feature, VIVA RIVA! premiered at Toronto and Berlin to positive notices from critics and awards bodies alike. It won 6 African movie awards, an MTV award for best African film and has sold widely internationally (US, UK, Australia, France, Germany...)In 2012, Djo founded his UK-based company to develop international projects and create content for a global market.

Isabelle Prim is a filmmaker born in 1984 in Paris, France. Beginning 2009 she received a two year stipend for The Fresnoy - National Studio of Contemporary Arts - where she shot "Mademoiselle Else", screened at the 63rd film festival of Locarno in 2010 and "La Rouge et la Noire" screened at the 62nd Berlinale International film festival of Berlin in 2012. She graduated from the High School of Fine Arts in Grenoble (France), and of the theatrical conservatory, after what she worked as a student-researcher in the ninth Postgraduate session of the Ensba (Fine art school of Lyon, France). She also studied in the department of Experimental Media of the Universitat Der Kunste of Berlin, where she produced "Creamy Krimi", screened at the 58th Berlinale. She is also an actress and an editor. Her practice spans fiction experimental films, video installations and animated films. She had numerous presentations of her work in contemporary art spaces and international film festivals, as for the 63rd film festival of Locarno, the 58th and the 62nd Berlinale, at the Palais De Tokyo in Paris, etc.

Good in french and German. 2001-2002 was living in USA, Utah.

Dominic Crisci is an Australian writer and producer. After completing Drama at QUT in 2007, Dominic went on to travel the world and gain experience below the line as an Assistant Director on music videos, corporate productions and commercials. Upon returning to Australia, his partnership with writer/director Chris Sun generated 3 award winning Australian horror feature films and gave him a taste for development and dramaturgy. Founding BMC in 2015, Dominic now works on developing and financing Australian feature projects while researching for his PhD in Directing for VR.

Nyell Leahy is an American actor from New Jersey. He was born into a diverse family of musicians, artists, and filmmakers. He has a rich multi-racial heritage, which has helped to bestow upon him a unique and handsome screen personality. Nyell discovered his passion for acting as a teenager and developed his skill through extensive training in New York City and through various acting opportunities. He was also born with exceptional athletic abilities, and he works daily to hone both the precision of his craft and his physical agility.

Dawn Krantz has an extremely broad range of experience in the entertainment, real estate and financial arenas and is a self proclaimed serial entrepreneur.Born in New York, raised in California, Krantz comes from a Hollywood family whose lineage overflows with talented, creative people including the founder of Paramount Pictures, Adolph Zukor, and cousins screenwriter, Stewart Stern, ("Rebel without a Cause", "The Ugly American") legendary musical Director, George Sidney ("Anchors Away, Bye Bye Birdie", Tony award winner, Sheila Bond ("Wish you were Here"), big band musicians, and many other artists and theater performers, on both her mother and father's side of the family. At the family gatherings there was always story telling and playing music and Dawn learned to love great story telling at an early age.In 1983, Krantz saw the rising trend of the video business and opened a video store chain in Austin, Texas. These stores ultimately became one of the most successful independent video store chains in the country. In addition, Dawn also opened a chain of full entertainment stores in factory outlet malls throughout the country.Krantz was voted in as a board member of the very prestigious Video Software Dealers Association (VSDA) from 1988-1995, eventually becoming Chairman of the Board, the only woman to ever hold this position. VSDA represented the major Hollywood studios and most independent studios as well as 35,000 video retailers around the world. During her time as Chairman, she helped produce the most successful entertainment convention in the world; started an extremely successful charity, Fast Forward to End Hunger with Jeff Bridges; and worked hand in hand with the MPAA lobbying in Washington for both the film and video game industry and helping define the video industry during its hay day.After selling her business, Dawn consulted with several very successful high tech, real estate and entertainment companies. She was then diagnosed with cancer and had to put everything on hold. When she got back on her feet she became a Realtor and in her third year, she sold 138 houses in one year, making her the # 1 agent in closed transactions in the US.In 2008, Dawn was approached to help finance a movie and in less then a month she raised $3,000,000 and green-lit the movie. With the real estate market crashing, she was back in show business. In 2010, Dawn moved back to California to produce films full time. Since then she has been building a very successful production company with more than 12 films in the slate with budgets from $3,000,000 - $100,000,000. Her last completed project was Man Down with Shia LaBeouf and Gary Oldman which was released by Lionsgate in 2016.Dawn has also been on the Board of South by Southwest Film Festival (SXSW) The Texas Angel Investors and The Capital Network. She was awarded Austin Business Woman of the Year, Nominated by Inc. Magazine for the prestigious award of Entrepreneur of the Year, was Video Retailer of the Year from the American Video Association and awarded one of the Top Video Store chains in the US multiple years.

Siddharth Kara is an author, screenwriter, activist, and leading expert on modern slavery. He is an adjunct lecturer at the Harvard Kennedy School of Government, a senior fellow at the Harvard School of Public Health, and a lecturer at the University of California, Berkeley.Kara is the author of numerous books and reports on modern slavery. His first book, "Sex Trafficking: Inside the Business of Modern Slavery," was co-winner of the 2010 Frederick Douglass Award at Yale University for the best non-fiction book on slavery. Kara adapted this book into the feature film, "Trafficked." Kara's second book, "Bonded Labor: Tackling the System of Slavery in South Asia" was released in October, 2012, and Kara's third book, "Modern Slavery: A Global Perspective" was launched at the United Nations in October, 2017.Since first encountering human trafficking in a Bosnian refugee camp in the 1990's, Kara has traveled to more than fifty countries across six continents to research modern slavery, personally documenting the cases of thousands of former and current slaves of all kinds, witnessing firsthand the sale of humans into slavery, and confronting some of those who trafficked and exploited them. Kara advises the United Nations, the U.S. Government, the International Labour Organisation, and several other governments on anti-trafficking policy and law. Kara has also appeared extensively in the media as an expert on human rights, including on CNN, the BBC, the Guardian, CNBC, National Geographic, and numerous documentary films.Previously, Kara was an investment banker at Merrill Lynch, then ran his own finance and M&A consulting firm. He holds a Law degree from England, MBA from Columbia University, and BA from Duke University.

A native New Yorker, Jim Brennan studied graphic design in Manhattan and tried his hand as a musician and songwriter before migrating to Colorado in his 20's. Jim then switched career gears and began working as a screenwriter, eventually moving into the role of producer. Since 2005 he has filled a variety of roles in a broad range of productions ranging from independent features to national advertising spots. He is also a founding partner at Rumblepack CCG, which creates media content for both domestic and international outlets. His most recent release is as the Executive Producer of the award winning horror film, An American Terror.Jim lives with his bride and two children in Colorado.12/11/2014

Aditi Vasudev (born 9th, December) is an Indian actress. Born in Lucknow, India, Vasudev began acting in theatre productions before venturing into films. She made her feature film debut playing Payal Duggal in Disney's first Indian live-action film, Do Dooni Chaar (2010). Vasudev has since worked in numerous ad films, short films and is best known for her roles in the drama-thriller Talaash (2012) and the slacker comedy Sulemani Keeda (2014).Aditi Vasudev was born in Lucknow, India, and completed her schooling in boarding schools in Dehradun. She moved to Mumbai in 2009, after dropping out of her first semester in Lady Shri Ram College where she studied Journalism.Vasudev began her career performing in several theatre productions and television commercials. She played a small part in an unreleased Amitabh Bachchan film, Johnny Walker, before landing a leading role in Do Dooni Chaar, Disney's first Indian live-action film. Directed by Habib Faisal, the film won the National Award for Best Film in 2011. Since then, Vasudev has been part of the commercially successful psychological thriller Talaash (2012) and the critically acclaimed Sulemani Keeda (2014). Vasudev made her television debut in 2016, in Meri Awaz Hi Pehchan Hai, a show loosely based on the rivalry between the musical sisters Lata Mangeshkar and Asha Bhonsle. In 2016, Vasudev starred in Alt Balaji's web series Bewaafa Sii Waafa. Vasudev has also starred in several short films, such as Skin Deep (2014), the award-winning Devi (2017) and the as yet unreleased Heat.

Cameron McKendry was born and raised in Cleveland, Ohio, where he knew he wanted to be an entertainer since he was just 3 years old. His career began with just dancing, mostly hip-hop- being invited to join the prestigious second class at Shaker Dance Academy in Shaker Heights, Ohio, at 8 years old- being paired up with teenagers and young adults. He then transitioned into acting at the age of 9, and began performing in professional and community theater in the Greater Cleveland area, including the Cleveland Play House in downtown Cleveland (A Christmas Story & Inherit the Wind). Around the age of 14, he transitioned into film- starring in numerous independent feature films, short films, and local and national commercials in Ohio. In 2014, Cameron made the move to Los Angeles, where he currently lives. Upon moving to LA, Cameron was signed with talent manager Ryan Daly at Zero Gravity Management, and later signed with agent Jason Zenowich at Abrams Artists Agency.He is mostly known for his leading role as Alex Dickerson in the 2016 PureFlix/Universal Studio's film I'm Not Ashamed (2016), centered on the life of Rachel Joy Scott- the first victim of the 1999 Columbine High School shooting. He is also known for his role in My Friend Dahmer (2017), playing a bully named Moose at Jeffrey Dahmer's high school. Other films Cameron has starred in include Madtown (2018), starring This Is Us star Milo Ventimilgia, with Cameron portraying the role of Mike Joss; The Pastor (2018), with Cameron playing the lead role of troubled teen Jacob Holloway; and An Accidental Zombie (Named Ted) (2018), has Cameron playing the lead role of Ted, a man who's in denial about an evil curse turning him into a zombie- also starring American Horror Story's Naomi Grossman, comedian Gary Anthony Williams, and Friday the 13th's Kane Hodder. Other credits in Cameron's career include indie flicks Since I Don't Have You (2013), Young Harvest (2013), Chasing Death (2013), A Reprise (2013), and Nickelodeon's Supah Ninjas. He recurred as the role of conservative student union president Josh in the fifth season of Freeform's hit series The Fosters (2018), and will be recurring in the upcoming third season of GO-90, Stage 13, and Warner Bros' horror-comedy series Snatchers (2017), who's first two seasons premiered at SXSW.

Grayson DeJesus is an actor, known for Kate Can't Swim (2017), Conviction (2016) and High Maintenance (2016).
Roos Dickmann is an actress, known for Hoe overleef ik? (2011), Soof: een nieuw begin (2017) and Taped (2012).
Se-Yeon Jin is an actress, known for Dakteo Yibangin (2014), Gam-gyeok-si-dae: Too-sin-eui tan-saeng (2014) and Ok-jung-hwa (2016).
Gump Gumpanart is an actor, known for Boy s tenyu 3. Posledniy raund (2011).

Ashley Young is best known for her work with Joel Potrykus and resides in Grand Rapids, Michigan. She obtained her BA in Psychology while producing her first feature, Ape (2012). Ape premiered at Locarno Film Festival in 2012 where it won Best New Director. Her second feature, Buzzard (2014), premiered at SXSW in 2014 and was acquired by Oscilloscope Pictures. Her third feature, The Alchemist Cookbook (2016) premiered at SXSW in 2016.

Mike was born in Dallas, Texas on April 10, 1968 and raised in the East Texas town of Mabank. He was raised by his grandparents. Growing up in a small town was tough at times, but Mike made use of his imagination to help him get through. He became very good at performing imitations, entertaining his school classmates with impersonations of Ronald Reagan, Howard Cosell , Jack Nicholson and John Wayne. Mike continues to do many voices such as George W. Bush, Cletus Klump, Al Pacino and many others. Mike's passion for acting really took over once he became an adult; joining the local civic theater. Soon after that, Mike landed roles as an extra in films and television. Mike's hard work paid off and he is now showing his abilities as an actor in films like "Devil's Deal", "Skookum", "Love Land" and "Not Abel" and his latest film, "Something In The Wood's". Along with his acting, Mike has written and produced the short film "Tough Love The Movie" and now has co-written the script for the movie "The Bluesman" with writer/director Eric Wayne Jones , now in pre-production , with the newly formed Midnight Strikes Films , Dallas Texas. with with several scripts ready to go such as "Famously Unknown", "One Night At The Surf", "Stray Cats & Hungry Wolves", and "My Dad, Arlo & Me"
Steve Laurence is a writer and producer, known for Art of Darkness (2012), Rise (2013) and Retaliation (2020).
Paulina Lagudi Ulrich is a producer and actress, known for Mail Order Monster (2018), Holly's Girl (2016) and This Is How (2016).
Coulee Nazha was born on May 2, 1992 in Urumqi, Xinjiang, China as Gülnezer Bextiyar. She is an actress, known for Fen shou da shi (2014), Feng ren ji yue dui (2017) and Pi Zi Ying Xiong 2 (2014).

Richa Langella, formerly known as Richa Gangopadhyay, is an Indian film actress, model and beauty queen. After winning the Miss India Michigan and Miss India USA titles in 2007, Richa moved to Mumbai, India to pursue a career in Indian cinema. She attended Anupam Kher's Acting School, Actor Prepares, after which she appeared in a few commercials before making her film debut as the lead in the Telugu film Leader. Richa played a variety of roles in the Telugu, Tamil and Bengali languages during her career in Indian cinema between 2009-2013, winning a number of awards for her performance for her most notable character, Yamini, in the Tamil film Mayakkam Enna. In 2013, Richa returned to the U.S. to complete her Bachelors in Communication with a minor in Theatre Arts from Eastern Michigan University, along with an MBA degree from the Washington University in St. Louis and pursue a career in business management.
